review: Jim is a great server.  We had a really lovely early dinner ordering Margarita pizza (which was PERFECT) and Green Pea-Barley soup for me (it's cold outside; this was nice and warming). Normally we love this restuarant, but... first of all the female hostess  welcomed us as 'Hi, Guys!"  We are two women.  She took us to our booth and again called us guys.  Just a little disconcerting. The music was awful and really too loud.  There was quite a din.  We often eat here and have not noticed the music being so loud and not really fit for eating and conversation. I do want to say, that when we thanked anyone for their service, they DID NOT say "No problem."  Thank you!!!

Parking: Right in front of Macy's. CPK is surrounded by parking. We came here for a celebration for work and reserved the patio area. The only complaint was that they didn't arrange the sun shade to block the light from blinding everybody. The servers were busy helping the people inside so I can't blame them.  But other than putting on some sunglasses, the food was what you expect. It isn't phenomenal but it will fill you up. I got the Kung Pao Spaghetti and it was more salty than spicy. I added chicken to it and there was very little chicken. For 13+ bucks, I do not recommend it.

Always reliable. I ordered flatbread which was delicious but skimpy on ingredients.  Also, why no calorie count on menu? Thought CPK used to include it. Server didn't know about it.  Large restaurant but women's restroom only has two stalls.

Decent place for lunch! Located just outside of the Manhattan Beach Mall, CPK has reliably adequate food and service and is a nice break from the drag of the office.  I came here recently on a Friday afternoon for lunch with 5 coworkers. Even though we were a large party, the restaurant wasn't nearly full so we were seated quickly. I was happy to learn that they offer a "Lunch Duo" option now, where you choose either a smaller personal pizza or sandwich, and a soup or salad. I ordered: Lunch Duo with Shaved Mushroom & Spinach Pizza and Caesar Salad ($11.95): the pizza is 7" which is a great portion for lunch, especially when you need to return to the office. The spinach was nice and garlicky, but I would have liked more mushroom.  The lunch duos are also one of the more affordable options for lunch. Our servers were also pretty quick, understanding we needed to return to the office fairly quickly. I would definitely come back for another combo!

One of our favorite places to come too. Have never really been here or at a CPK for lunch before. We always come for dinner. Lunch menu looks good, pizza & a salad and the wife had there potato soup. As usual food was good & service was good. The only reason fir 4 star and not 5 is because choices to pizza & salad were limited but good still.

Wasn't a big fan of CPK after my horrible experience at the Hollywood location; however, after management reached out to me I decided to try it again and come to this location.  Everything was awesome as the service was great and the Italian Chopped Salad was chopped and served to perfection. The manager stopped by and told him everything was great. He mentioned to me that the kitchen staff has been here a long time and they follow the original menus of CPK which is why the food is a higher standard.  Will absolutely be back and check out my photo on the chopped salad as this is as good as it gets!

Upon this visit to this California chain famous for inventing the BBQ Chicken Pizza I decided to opt for a listed Menu Favorite, the Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza.  The pizza was decent, but at $15 it's a bit pricey and on the small side if you ask me.  Frankly, I'd say that most of the dishes are overpriced.  My ex's mom though was a big chain restaurant fan and she loves good ole CPK.  As for me, I'll typically go with more local options.  Perfectly fine, but nothing special.

Very disappointed, enjoyed this restaurant for years but recently food has become very subpar. We visited last month and quality of food had seriously deteriorated. I wrote an email to management and received no reply. At that point I should have realized that management couldn't care less, but we made one last visit in hopes that things might have improved. Once again quality of food was terrible. Sad to see a local restaurant deteriorate.

Another one of my favorite lunch places. I usually have the veggie pizza and quinoa salad lunch special, but there grilled veggie sandwich is delicious. Try the California wine flight with it. TAsty! Another day here, just had the arugula and asparagus salad with the mushroom spinach flat bread, delish. Of course with the wine flight, one white and two red.

A cool location for CPK in Manhattan Beach. The place is pretty busy and it gets noisy during lunch. For an appetizer, I highly recommend the Avacado Rolls. Crunchy rolls filled with avocado, bacon, and cheese. It is super delicious. The pizzas are great and our server Gabby was very nice. I had a good time at this location.

A safe choice. And an even better choice for picky eaters who are afraid to try new and different foods. This only happens to me when travelling with big groups where it is hard to decide on a place for everyone to enjoy. For some reason it was very crowded when we arrived but they gave us an option to be seated immediately outside on one of their patios. They were even nice enough to inform us that one of the patios was about to be used by a graduation party so we definitely went with the other patio. Not that it made much difference because right as we sat down another graduation party sat next to us but still, it was nice of them to offer. My mom and I split a veggie pizza and salad. It was plenty of food and we still had a couple slices left over. We didn't have any dessert this time but they do have a very good tiramisu!

This review is not just about the food & service but the senior staff as well! Our meal, Caesar Salad, Cheese & tomato pizza & the salmon were delicious & prepared to our specific order. Our waiter, a 16 year vet, was terrific.  Here's we're our next category comes in to play! After dinner our bill was presented, needing to leave I put our gift certificate & CC out to take care of the bill. Well our waiter came back & said there's nothing on the gift card? Say again, well needing to leave & of course not being his fault, I said run the CC & we left.  The next day I called & spoke with Brain the assistant GM who was not only understanding but after listing to my tale, simply said how much was on the gift card, I told him then he said I'm terribly sorry for the inconvenience, please come in at your convenience and ask for me, I'll have a replacement card ready and activated waiting for you!!  Talking about great customer service, Brian, your sir are what great CS is all about!! A solid 5 out of 5 stars! And customers that will bring friends & family in for lunch or dinner when they're visiting! Thanks again Brian & CPK.

Sorry guys - I love your food, but today was not so great. To start, I ordered a catering package for curbside pickup and there was no place to park, so I had to park in the lot and walk in. I had specified curbside delivery at 11:00 and I waited in the restaurant until 11:40 to receive my order. I hate to complain, but when I'm spending lots of $$$ for a business lunch I'm responsible for hosting, I need to be assured I won't be left hanging. Again, so sorry to leave a poor review, but I want to keep using you and need the timing to be better! :) That said, on the plus side, everyone was very nice!
Sent an email to corporate to mention the issue, and the manager of the restaurant called to apologize and make things right.  I give him credit.

Nice little outdoor patio area, which we got it all to ourselves, and I got to bring two pups with me to hang out.  Glad to see that the waiters and waitresses didn't pay too much attention the pups (to overexcite them), but our waiter was very nice enough to provide them each waters! We got their spinach artichoke dip to share and I got myself their chicken garlic pizza. Our waiter was super attentive and very nice and funny. Good little location!
First visit and the food was great except for the service. I expected a slight delay due to lunch hour, but they got my order wrong and I ended up waiting a bit longer to get my food.

Nisha the manager took the time to help me out on a busy Friday. Her customer service is awesome. The pizza was delicious and delivered on time for my event and a huge success! I will definitely use California Pizza Kitchen again.

Terrible food. Like a cheap diner. Went there twice, hoping the food would be better. Bad mistake. I could detail what was wrong, but I'll just summarize by saying "Don't go there. Go somewhere else!"
Not a fan of this place, but their butter cake OMG! Sooo good. Cake was so lost and warm and their ice cream was good.

Everything is delicious, great service, my favorite waiter is Jacky! She's so polite and quick with request... I've been coming for years and will continue to do so.  Try the California Pizza Club with no basil!
Great place for lunch or dinner. Friendly staff and tasty foid. Ample parking with handicap spots near front door.

I loooooove CPK, and I've never had a bad experience at this location. The servers are always attentive, the food is always great, and there's plenty of seating so there's never a wait either.  Dropped in on Christmas Eve expecting a ton of hangry Christmas shoppers but was pleasantly surprised. We got seated right away, and I tried a Blood Orange Sangria and an order of hummus to start. The sangria was good, a little sweeter than expected though. The hummus was delicious, and the bread it was served with was warm and fresh.  I ordered a bowl of the tortilla soup and a BBQ chopped chicken salad, and my friend ordered a carne asada pizza (seasonal option). Everything was amaaaazing. I'm never disappointed by anything with avocado, chicken, tomato, etc. My friend's carne asada pizza was great too. It came with a delicious green salsa to top the pizza with, great addition to the pizza.  Overall a great location serving quality food!

I enjoyed coming in here. Tristian and Alex were very helpful. I initially stated that the wait on the phone was too, long. Though, their great customer service and professionalism made up for the wait. Some places will quickly speed up service when they are 30 min from closing and they continued to be assertive. They both took time to help me figure out my order, and even catered to my 5 year old. As she was coughing, Tristian immediately asked if my daughter wanted water. I was pleased with the takeout service and I will return.
Pretty good CPK location for Dine in or take out!  The staff is friendly and managers are awesome!  Food is good as usual. Defiantly my go to CPK in the area.

Went in for Mother's Day lunch today. My pasta was so dry. My moms pasta was dry. Very disappointing. Bread was given right before our meals were served. My mom ordered a strawberry lemonade received a regular lemonade with little ice then the waitress acknowledged she made a mistake my mom said that's okay though the waitress still didn't bring the right drink.  I guess I was expecting too much

CPK is one of my favorite dine-in restaurants. What I come for and always get: 1. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine: Creamy jalapeno lime sauce with spinach fettuccine, red onions, bell peppers, and fresh cilantro **TIP: Ask for lime slices and squeeze it on top of your dish before eating! (1-2 lime slices depending on your liking) 2. Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza: Chipotle adobo sauce, shaved poblanos and Monterey Jack with housemade roasted corn & black bean salsa, fresh cilantro, and tangy lime crema This time I just came for a FREE DESSERT.  (CPK Rewards - Free dessert for your birthday. GO SIGN UP!!) Belgian Chocolate Souffle Cake: Warm chocolate cake served w/ triple-thick hot fudge and vanilla bean sauce (scoop of Haagen-Dazs ice cream for additional cost) **TIP: Ask for the ice cream on the side! It comes out in a separate cup so it's not touching the warm cake at all. This prevents the ice cream from melting away quickly.

I've been a loyal customer for years and I must say CK has always had excellent service and always goes above and beyond for his customers. This place is great and renovations will make it even better. This is definitely my favorite spot for lunch. If you visit, ask for CK!
Petite wedge salad tiniest piece of iceberg lettuce. It used to be great-- won't order again!

I usually love to come here to have a glass of wine! Today was not a good day. Talk about terrible service. Walked in with my friend today during lunch time and ordered our food and drink and the same time. After thirty minutes, our food and drink both seemed to be lost. Another ten minutes went by and our food finally arrived. My order was wrong of course. I had to wait another 15 minutes for them to bring out the correct order. The fact that I was starving made things 10x worse. We didn't complain but the manager just happened to walk by and notice our drinks were still not out. Turns out the waitress forgot them inside. He did come out at the end and gave us both a card stating our next meal was on them but it was a little too late! It's not the managers fault but the waitress definitely needs some training.
Great place for lunch or dinner. Friendly staff and tasty foid. Ample parking with handicap spots near front door.

I eat here often with my family, the food is always 5 stars. Managers are cool. Some redhead waitress once literally had me storming out pissed off though. First she hands us nasty silverware, with a big glob of food dried on it. I ask her to double check for a clean set and she blindly grabs another set that's still wrapped up-- clearly didn't check. We ask for water, stressing that she check the glasses. Of course, one is dirty. Appetizer late, arrives after food, but awesome manager immediately runs over and takes it off the bill, totally unprompted. Cool! Food and drinks are delicious. Now, there's a promo... $10 off of 40. Were at like $58 with tax n drinks, but $35 without. I ask the waitress how much were at and she says she will check. Comes back and says "you guys still need another $15, so I don't think it's worth it" and plops the bill on the desk before disappearing. I immediately know she's lying, and review the bill. Yep. Almost exactly the amount of one dessert.  I flagged her down like 5 times but she never came back so I had to grab another waiter/manager to order a pie to reach the discount. paid the bill and walked out without waiting for the pie. Sweetheart manager rushed out to our car to bring us the pie. I felt bad at this point, but I let him know waitress sucked. the pie is her tip.

This is just okay. Service was extremely slow. Our server was busy engaged in a lengthy conversation with another staff at our expense.  Food was consistent with other CPK restaurants. I like the Kung Pao spaghetti and CPK's pizzas are not the best, but still unique and tasty.

It is your standard CPK. I would say that the service is a bit slow; the greeter looked like he really needed coffee and our server seemed out of reach when we needed her.  But I love this location because of the Fire Grilled Ribeye we got!  Not all locations have this so I am happy to have tried it here.  It was topped with creamy bleu cheese butter and came with arugula salad and roasted potatoes. We also tried the Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza and the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine. All the food was good, and between the four of us, it was the perfect amount of food!

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Great food but superb service. J.b. Served me and my parents today and did a wonderful job. He frequented our table just a perfect amount without being overbearing.  Thanks J.B. Because of you we will be back.
Having dinner. It was fabulous. I had the spicy chipotle pizza with shrimp instead of chicken and my King had the mahi mahi tacos and he loved it. The food and service is exceptional.
BBQ chicken is great. Food is filling, but I wouldn't come here if I wanted pizza, there is way better ones all over the city.

The service is great!   Went here and our server for the to go menu was awesome!  He even took off the charge for  a yucky soda we ordered. While we were waiting, he heard my voice was gone and served my sister and I some hot tea with honey.    Thanks for the wonderful service!   The food: I ordered a Cajun pasta dish.  It was just okay.  Yes, I know, I know the rule, California PIZZA Kitchen, yes I should have ordered a pizza. Cajun does not mean make it spicy and that's it.  It should be spicy with good flavor. And the flavor was just okay.  Now the oil with the herb mix they give you is grrrrrrrrreat!  yummy! yummy.  I certainly COULD have gotten full off of break and herb oil.   I would certainly come back to have another meal...yes, pizza, I will try the pizza.

Sometimes I feel compelled to write a review because it was such a damn good experience!  I've been to cpk many times before so I'm familiar with the food. We got the spinach artichoke dip which is so garlicky and good. Then got the garlic alfredo pasta and BBQ chicken salad and split them. Very good as well. Had a glass of red zin that was very good as well and a healthy pour.  But what made this experience so great was the service. We didn't have much time as we were trying to make a movie and were worried about being sat right away on a busy night. They sat us immediately and were so attentive the whole night. Our server, Noah, was amazing! Go there and ask for him!
Love their Asian salad. The service was good however the table service was a little slow but overall I thought they did a good job The atmosphere is nice my family enjoyed it I recommend returning

This place was recommended to me by more than one person so I decided to give it a shot tonight. What a disappointment! I ordered a mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza to go. It smelled decent on the ride home so I was looking forward to enjoying some good pizza. Unfortunately, once I was home I discovered that (1) the crust was shockingly thin, (2) the pepperoni and sausage were extremely scant, and (3) the pizza was so incredibly salty that I could barely finish a single slice. After that the rest of the pizza was discarded. I won't be back.

This is a good go to place for me with friends when we don't know where to eat. It has salads and pizzas and soups and meats and pastas. It's got a little bit of many types of food but not all crazy mostly American Italian. I get the Cobb salad and my friends get pizza or Asian salads. We love to just relax and know the service will be good.
Food is good service is above average but menus were dirty in and out, food remains on all.  Overall cleanliness need's slight overhaul.

My wife and I came for dinner. We normally go to the location in MDR but came to this one as we were in the area. The service at this location was very poor. First of all we were seated in corner of the restaurant right by where there were people waiting to pickup grubhub orders. We also had pizza dough piadina rewards but our server didn't let us use that. Once we placed the order, we asked our server to get us more bread and refills for our drinks which he never did. The food also took a long time to come out and when a girl came out with food, we asked her for more bread and refills and she told us that the server will take care of it. I had ordered a pasta and wanted some parmesan cheese on them. Had to wait and remind the server for cheese and again for drinks and more bread. Got the refills but not the bread. Then when the manager walked by we reminded him that this is not how service should be. Our request to get more bread was heard and ignored 3 times. If you don't want to give more bread just say no, don't keep on ignoring it. The food was as expected from a cpk but the service made this a horrible experience. Never going back to this location.
Pizzas are the tiny but expensive. The worst is the key lime pie for $7 that is just one tiny slice. Order from Grimaldis or any other pizza place in the area and you'll be much happier.

I understand this restaurant closes at 10pm, but when you have guests who arrive st 9:15 pm and trying to eat your meal you shouldn't have workers moving tables around .. sweeping up dust then vacuuming around you while you're trying to enjoy a meal I get this I don't a fine dining establishment but the major clean up shouldn't happen I until the restaurant CLOSES.... the waitress was nice,  but it's disrespectful to your customers to have the dining area cleaned while you are eating

location: Carmel Mountain Ranch, San Diego, CA
review: Miss old la food show's Waldorf salad. Cpk has an ok version. The tequila chicken was yummy- noodles were a little too al dente they had to book it a bit longer for me. They were pretty nice. I wouldn't have tried it if it wasn't for la food show being gone. I would try again though.

We had my daughter's birthday party at CPK recently.  Everything exceeded our expectations. We dined in the patio area, kids got to tour the kitchen.  Cindy was our hostess and took such good care of the kids the entire time.  The kids were telling me that next time they go back to CPK, they want to look for Cindy and say hi to her because she is so nice.  Kids had fun making their own pizza, decorating their chef hat, and eating ice cream sundae.  This is such a great place to have kids birthday party.  Thank you to everyone at CPK for being so welcoming and provided such a wonderful experience for us.

Good food and great friendly service by Jessica.  The pizza looked great however the dough was very chewy and not crispy.  I think the manager said they use rice flour.  Great Italian pizza use 00 flour for the dough, just saying.

Why I would expect this place to actually have good pizza is curiously wrapped up in the name ONLY. I ordered the garlic chicken pizza and it came cold, dry, and tasteless. My wife ordered the Cobb salad that could have come from a courthouse cafeteria. All for the low, low price of $32.00. Throw in a 6.00 draft beer from their one of 4 crap selections and you have a 40.00 waste of time. The waitress seemed uninterested in us even though we sat right by the server station. Other than that it was great. Please don't eat here.

Busy lunch on Valentine's Day so I will give them a pass on service. Flagging down a server for more cocktails or wine is annoying...not to mention detrimental to the service establishments sales. In any case despite the crowd and 20 minute wait for a table, we sat immediately at the bar. Always enjoy sitting at the bar...it's fun to watch the food prep and smell the delicious aromatics from the kitchen. I had my favorite halibut with farrow and butternut squash which I'm afraid was subpar this visit.  The fish was dry as was the farrow and I counted only 3 cubes of squash. The asparagus was decent, but I still had to cut an inch and a half off the end...simply too stringy and chewy (I usually have to do this anyway before I steam or sauté...this step may have been missed.) I absolutely must let the team know next time...this time I allowed the busy day mask the problems with the preparation and I'm sure they would have liked to know. This won't prevent me from visiting again...I'm a CPK fan through and through.
Staffs were really nice! Especially 'Juan' who is our server, he helps me a lot Thank you so much good food and kind service!
Absolutely enjoyed dinner here with my daughter. Great food, but the best was customer service from Jim our waiter and the manager. Love coming here for great food and exceptional service!

Haven't eaten from this chain in years and forgot if I liked it or not. It was alright, but too pricey for what it is. Ordered "The Works" Pizza. Came with green bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, olives, sausage, and pepperoni. I also decided to add two sunny side up eggs on my pizza and immediately regretted it when the pizza came and I saw that one of the eggs was smashed. The yolk was running everywhere turning the crust into a cold, soggy mess. The pizza was alright, but the soggy crust made it really unappetizing. We did get delivery though, so maybe the two eggs on the pizza is properly executed when dining in, but for delivery I would hold off on the eggs. The pizza itself reminded me of frozen pizza. Bland toppings, sauce and crust, but edible! Thought the sausage was decent. I also didn't think the prices were justified by the quality of ingredients. About 17 bucks for a tiny pizza with cold, soggy crust covered in cold egg goo (not counting tax and tip). I won't be too eager to come back here anytime soon Pros: + Decent sausage Cons: - Poorly executed/delivered pizza - Bland cheese - Soggy crust - Pricey
Always good! Tried a salad this trip and it was excellent. We got the large size Thai salad and it was more than enough for my wife and me.

I've been coming here for a number of years. Conveniently located between work and home. Parking can be a pain since it is located in Manhattan Village. I decided to take advantage of the Veteran's Day menu - you get to select one item and it's free to all veterans. The menu includes a good selection of  pizzas, pastas and salads. I went with the simple pepperoni pizza. Nice crust, tasty sauce and seasoned with a little spiciness. For my drink I selected a Coconut Blossom (vodka, tequila, agave sour, coconut & pineapple juice). It was refreshing  and was strong. I didn't get it until I was practically done with my pizza though. The staff is friendly and will normally open the door for you when you're exiting. My favorite waitress was Alyssa who no longer works there.

Walter (the manager) made my experience great. I rushed in for a company lunch and I was STARVING so I went to the bar and asked for "avocado rolls" not mentioning that I am vegetarian and I didn't know there would be chicken inside the rolls. Once they came, my co workers dived in and touched all the rolls... Now I see they have chicken and I can't eat them. Walter took care of the situation promptly and made sure I got some vegetarian rolls in my belly right away ! Thank you so much for your exceptional service and great food!

Thanks CPK for sending us a free kids meal & a free birthday dessert as we would not have thought to come for dinner. We had a yummy dinner with awesome service tonight. Our server Des was Great!! He even brought out our son's pizza we left behind. I started with the arugula & asparagus salad & we split the garlic chicken & vegetables entree both were delicious. Our free dessert was the warm chocolate soufflé topped w ice cream, yummy!!

CPK is your basic chain restaurant, but they really do have a great selection and some delicious meals. I came here on a Tuesday night around 9 and it was still pretty crowded. This was my first time at this location since I typically go to the location in Redondo Beach.  The service here was very attentive and friendly. They stopped by several times to refill drinks and to bring out extra items that we asked for. // FOOD // BBQ chicken chopped salad: This is always a must for me when I come to CPK. The salad is so refreshing with lettuce, corn, beans, tomatoes and shredded chicken in a ranch sauce with BBQ sauce on top. The slice of lime that they serve with it adds on extra flavor.  Habanero carnitas pizza: This is probably one of my more favorite pizzas at CPK. Shredded carnitas, red onions with a habanero sauce on the side. This pizza is definitely packed with flavor. The carnitas adds a smoky flavor while the habanero sauce adds heat, but also some sweetness to the pizza.  Chicken piccata: The chicken piccata was pretty good. It was served with pasta and I really enjoyed the sauce. It had the right amount of lemon to it, but also the butter and capers added plenty of salt to the dish. Overall, this was a great CPK location to come to. I will definitely be back if I'm around the area.

Walked in decided to order a take out Turkey sandwich after 20 minutes I had to inquire where my sandwich this place is horrible for walking callin, or curbside orders guaranteed 20-25 minute wait. Overpriced and goofy management team no wonder the ratings are 3 star..

My first time at the Manhattan location and I liked it. I'm picky about restaurants noise levels and crowd and there was a good amount of space between my table and the next. And our service Ames really great. He came by a lot to check on my table. I like that a lot
The CPK Chopped Salad is defined by its Basil Aroma , and yet they bring a yellow wish salad with little to NO BASIL in it, and no offer to grinding some pepper seasoning ever occurred . :(

The ribeye is better than most high end restaurants.   The service at the bar was excellent which allowed us to enjoy the game and drink and be merry.   Greenbay won!! Jasmine is an awesome bartender.  She always used the tall glasses.

This place is a joke just waited 34 minutes in the building for it to go order that was placed 15 minutes ago only to have the  person tell me that I told her a different name and that's why she didn't tell me anything just let me sit there for 34 minutes and did nothing one person said a word to me the whole time I was there pathetic service and management obviously you don't care about your customers

I just can't believe how RUDE this employee was when I called for a take out order. I had ordered BBQ chicken salad and soup as part of the lunch special (as I assumed). Picked up my order this past Friday  07/28/2017 (12:15p)  with no issues. I enjoyed my experience so much, that I called Monday 07/31/2017 (12:15p) and ordered the same special. Only to have an employee tell me that I can't order the BBQ chicken salad as part of the lunch special. I explained why this was and apparently who ever took my order Friday afternoon made a mistake. How is it my fault that CPK can't properly train their employees to take down orders and mislead their customers!!! When I demanded I speak with the manager the employee hung up the phone on me. I will NEVER eat at CPK ever again nor will I recommend anyone to eat there.

Just had lunch at California pizza kitchen and the food and service was great! We had the lunch special a pizza with a salad. It's great deal and the food was awesome! The waitress was funny and helpful and very attentive! We will definitely be coming back. Did I mention that they have great wine selection and hard alcohol! Can't go wrong for a nice lunch!

Well I am from Montreal and I traditionally come to this franchise restaurant on my first day of my vacation. I was slightly disappointed that the Tostada pizza is no longer on the menu. However, I had the thin crust spicy Italian pizza and It was great and spicy. The service was ok even though the waitress was training another waitress. Reading other reviews I find this place a little underrated.

Holy families galore, Batman! I hadn't been to a CPK for about 15 years. I didn't remember it being a mecca for children. I came with my mom for dinner on a Friday since it was right across from her office. We were seated right away, but from the get go there were kids literally running everywhere and screaming all over the place. My mom ordered her usual Moroccan-Spiced Chicken Salad with roasted butternut squash, dates, avocado, toasted almonds, beets, red peppers, chopped egg, cranberries, and tossed with their house-made Champagne vinaigrette. She really likes it, but I didn't care for it. I ordered the White Pizza with Mozzarella, Ricotta, Parmesan, Pecorino Romano, sautéed spinach and roasted garlic. That's what I ordered 15 years ago, but it wasn't as I remembered. The roasted garlic came in huge chunks sparsely dispersed over the pizza. It's pretty gross to get a bite full of garlic. I would much rather prefer to have smaller crushed pieces over the whole pie. Other than that, it still wasn't very good. The White Top from Blaze is better, faster, and tastier. I also ordered a watermelon lemonade. A manager who brought our order to our table asked if I wanted a refill. I said, "Yes, please." He came back with a drink that was orange rather than pink. Before I even said anything he assured me that it was a watermelon lemonade, but from a different machine. Once I tasted it, I realized that it was a mango lemonade. It was fine. However, why tell me it's for sure watermelon when it wasn't and obviously didn't even look the same. Service from our waitress was alright. However, with the sup-par food and ambiance, I won't be coming back. At least not for another 15 years.

CPK serves more than pizza and I've been happy with their food the past two times I've been here. They have good choices for their light menu. You can get pasta, sandwiches, salads and of course, unique pizzas like Chipotle chicken with poblanos and roasted corn.  Lunch service was very slow, possibly so because our group of 7 was served by two waitresses.  I think there was confusion between servers and also miscommunication with the kitchen as a result.  My friends, who are regulars, say the service is usually good. I wish they hadn't waited 20 minutes to ask us if we wanted bread.  Our food: -Margharita pizza - we ordered goat cheese with it and it was awesome. Great crust, too. Big pieces of basil, not skimpy shreds.  -BBQ chicken salad - good but needed more dressing.  -Lite shrimp scampi w zucchini slices - good but the lemon taste dominated the garlic too much. I like how they added the zucchini to make it healthier.  Another light option I had before is the - arugala quinoa, feta cheese salad with added chicken. Excellent and filling.  -Kung pao chicken with spaghetti - I didn't try it but my friend gave it a thumbs up -Bianco flatbread pizza - white truffle cream Gorgonzola, mozzarella and fresh sage. My friend's mother loved it.  -Spicy fennel sausage and poblano flatbread - good but only small pieces of sausage -Kids' curly pasta with butter and cheese - big bowl but the boy inhaled this and still ate other food  -Chicken piccata. My sister has a garlic allergy. She ordered the chicken piccata after learning it had no garlic. She found some pieces that looked like garlic and spoke to our waitress and showed them. The waitress got the manager who assured us the recipe hangs in the kitchen and is garlic free. He offered to remake the dish but my sister opted instead to get a Hawaiian personal pizza, which they rushed to be made. The pizza had large pieces of both ham and the fruit. I'm not a fan but it was a good slice.  CAUTION: Kids beverages are really sweet. I would taste your child's lemonade. It was way too sweet and needed diluting. Kids have enough energy as it is.  CPK is a casual place with good value for fair prices.  I may find myself here more often because there are more things I want to try.

Came here on a Tuesday night for a post movie dinner date with El Hubby Cakes. It was very busy for a week night. That's a good sign! We had... -Avocado Club Eggrolls as appetizer - Stuffed with bacon, chicken, jack cheese and avocado. creamy, crispy and delicious! Don't think about the calories. Just get it!  -Wild Mushroom Pizza. 3 kinds of mushroom with white sauce. Very hearty and flavorful. -Original BBQ Chicken Chopped salad with avocado. Love the crispy tortilla chips against the cool crisp lettuce and tangry dressing!  Service was okay. Our server didn't engage much, but he was very polite. I didn't give it 4 stars was because they gave us a dirty table. It was still wet n sticky. We asked one of the staff to clean it again. Once the table was cleaned, we held the menu and it was wet n sticky on the bottom part. Really? Gosh, we were turned off, we almost left. But we decided to stay because I really wanted to use my $50 gf that my friend gave me and didn't wanna drive to another CPK.  Other than that, the food was great! But I don't think I'll come back to this location.

Having grown up in the area, I've visited this CPK many times.  Maybe management changed something around recently, but this time the service and food were spot on. Went with the family on Mother's Day, and we were quickly seated and taken care of. We opted for the: - Chicken & Shrimp Lettuce Wraps (healthy/filling as usual) - Spicy Fennel Sausage & Poblano Flatbread (very good) - Caribbean Jerk Pizza Thin Crust (amazing) Great food that came out quick and super friendly service (shout out to our waiter Desmond). I write this because if you had a bad experience at this CPK, give them another chance!

This 5 stars goes to the slender guy who wears glasses. I believe he's tall, maybe blonde. He is exceptional. I wish I knew his name :( He helped me twice with my togo order and was so friendly and attentive. I appreciate anyone who has to deal (yes deal) with customers who still knows how to quickly connect and make you feel like they don't have a million other things to do, like I'm sure he does. Thank you for your great customer service!

I have been coming to this location for over 20 years. It unfortunately has evolved into a different type of establishment that its creators had originally intended. Once a casual, yet avant-garde restaurant has turned into a loud, kid packed, mess hall.  I could say that this change might be due to a changing demographic and a new wave of young families moving into the area. This though, is not the case as the change in clientele is reflective of CPKs menu. CPK was known for introducing new and exciting entrees with particular emphasis on Pizza. Now, the menu has stagnated and many items are becoming long in the tooth. The menu isn't reflective of an exciting offering, but rather entrees that appeal to a child's palate. That goes for all CPKs and not just this establishment. Additionally, the noise level is pretty high at this store and management has decided to play loud music to drown it out. This isn't working. Recommendations The Kung Pao Spaghetti is still very good. I hope this isn't removed from the menu. Avocado egg rolls are also very good. The chicken dumplings are good...when they're hot...which is rare.

Place is excellent!  Loved the food and excellent excellent service.  Waitress Lena was amazing.  So kind and helpful and always ready to help.  Will defintely be back and have her serve us again.  Such a great visit.  Good food ...good service.... good place....  Will be back for sure.   Thanks CPK and Thank you Lena!
Standard CPK, service was good and the food was the usual.

Had lunch on a weekday with my parents, in-laws and kids. They were able to seat us right away but the restaurant was pretty crowded. Our waiter took a long time to take our order, but was very friendly. It took them a long time to refill water and bread requests. I ordered the kids food first and asked that it be brought as soon as it was ready. The kids pasta was way under-cooked and we had to return it. The second dish of the pasta was much better. The kids grilled chicken was very tender and tasty. I ordered the tostada pizza and it was decent - nothing too exciting, but tastes good enough. Other people in our group had the spinach and artichoke pizza, the mushroom pizza and the cheese pizza. Everyone was happy with their order. Overall it is a good place for a group to go at a decent price for decent food. Nothing overly exciting or fancy.
Everything was Amazing  I ordered the Ribeye steak, Was Cooked Perfectly  The Service is Great  Thanks you All for Amazing meal

I was pleasantly surprised with the good customer service at this CPK. We were in a hurry, so we sat at the bar and our order was taken within the next few minutes. Due to dietary restrictions, I asked if the Gouda on their pizza was aged, and their manager came to speak with me to personally answer my questions, which I definitely appreciate.  Foodwise, my lunch was average and similar to what I expected from CPK. I had the lunch duo of Turkey+Brie sandwich with a cup of tortilla soup, which was good but I would probably order the Moroccan chicken salad (my default order whenever I happen to go to CPK) instead of this duo next time.  This CPK has relatively quick service and a good location in the shopping center. I recommend going if you are a fan of CPK food, otherwise I would try a different pizza place.
a three o'clock lunch for my day- this little house surprised me... must try their new farmers market soup...YUMMMMMM cobb salad is good too

I honestly felt some type of way visiting this CPK I came sat at the lil bar I had to flag down the greater to ask if I could get a glass of water and glass of wine  to start after waiting patiently for a lil over 10 min . Then she tells me oh our bartender is on break so there is no one at the bar to service me. Then I had to give her the bright idea of just grabbing a server for me . I may sound petty for this but customer service is everything to me. I'll just stick to my CPK in long beach

My daughter loves this place and really annoys me to go there.  We love the Garlic Cream Fettuccine with Shrimp no tails.  It's always freshly made and tastes like it.  My one issue with them is that they gave up the bread they used to serve.  Whhyyy?  Their new bread will break a tooth in a heartbeat.

Chain restaurant goodness :p Been to many various cpk locations and I've tried a lot of their different dishes and for the most part I haven't ever really been disappointed with my food. I have a couple GO TO choices that I crave quite often actually. I love the avocado roll for a starter and for pizza I love the club, so good and for pasta, the chicken tequila is definitely clutch! Their lemonades are also tasty and don't forget to leave room for dessert because those too are yummy :)  It may not be authentic or traditional but for what they are individually, it's pretty tasty and I always leave satisfied when I have a bite of my favorite dishes here.  Pretty sad they removed one of my favorite dishes though which was the portobello mushroom ravioli in garlic cream sauce! Such a shame, it was sooo good!   Overall, I am a fan of cpk :) Happy eats, loves! ^_^

WHAT THE H-E DOUBLE HOCKEY STICK IS GOING ON HERE!?! I remember a day when I told my husband "I hate CPK, I won't go there".  We ended up there for dinner last night because our friend locked his keys in his car near CPK, so we rescued him (thanks AAA). We looked around and of course I wanted Islands because I love their veggie burger (the only thing I love about that damn place), but they weren't having it. Pizza it is. We walk in and were immediately greeted by 2 hosts, very nice. It was busy but not packed. We decided to sit at the bar. I've never done that before where you can actually see the kitchen staff cook and prepare food. It's amazing. Do it. I was mesmerized the whole time by their running around, baking, flipping, chopping, slicing, etc. We were greeted again immediately by a nice lady giving us menu's and asking for our drink order. She was really nice and fast. A different server brought us some bread and dipping oil. Ah May ZING. Where did they get this magical olive oil? I have no idea but its freakin good. The bread was soft and warm. Perfection. We ordered, the food came fast and was excellent. We decided on an Italian Chopped Salad and White Pizza with bacon added. Outstanding. Just plain perfection.   The check came quick and was only 40 bucks. I had a glass of wine, so I'm impressed.  The service and food was so excellent I almost forgot they didn't give us silverware when they served us. That's totally fine guys. I don't mind an innocent mistake if everything else is perfection. I'll definitely be back for more. And if I get another fine experience like this one, I might bump it up the 5 stars.

Be sure to check that you leftovers were packed. Didn't notice until I got home that my pizza wasn't packed. The service wasn't much better. I asked waiter for more napkins, they never came. Please, I'm eating pizza, never offered more napkins than the one the silverware was wrapped in, nor delivered when asked. I guess in M.B. you're expected to use fork & knife, not eat with your hands. No worries CPK, I won't be back, don't have to worry about heathens visiting that eat pizza with their hands.

I love CPK but been waiting for a while now for what reason I don't know. Six people have been called in front of me two which showed up after me by about ten minutes. Funny sitting here listening to them speak about my trained SD  I don't know about the dog the manager I think walked up and kneeled down and asked if my dog can sit under the booth hmmm yeah she can that's ummm what she is trained to do. Oh ok and she walked off. This lady I think is the manager it's funny watching her gripe at customers who are asking about weight and she is getting in there face. So hilarious. When you have a long wait be prepared to deal with customers who want answers. I'm pretty close to walking up. When I came in I saw six free tables.  Yeah there is officially no one waiting now except me. This is ridiculous. They got five minutes before I walk away and go to Santa Monica CPK  which has a thousand time better service.  Might want to tell people when you say oh it's a couple minute wait or 5-10 not make them wait 20 -40 minutes. Wish I can review the food but I think I'm going to leave and head to Santa Monica.

Food was the normal CPK however when the bill came it was a different story.  We had ordered two pizzas and a kids pizza for the kids to share. When the bill arrived they charged us for a regular pizza. I questioned the charge and the waiter came to the conclusion that I wanted a whole pizza and not a kids pizza. Geeeee I have two small kids I clearly ordered a kids pizza for the kids.  Well the manager comes over and interrogates us wondering why we didn't return the pizza when it came out...! Ummm hello I ordered a Kids pizza. I expected what I ordered. How was I to know what a kids size pizza is. The manager was visibly upset and pissed and was rude and disrespectful.  Will NeVEr step foot in CPK again.

I went here yesterday and I was very impressed with the service. We only waited ~10 minutes to be seated which is really good for a Friday night and our server was very attentive.  Anytime i go to a CPK i always order the mutigrain pesto cream penne with extra mushrooms.  I rarely get appetizers but this time i tried the Mediterranean spring rolls and it was absolutely delicious.

Birthday celebration via @calpizzakitchen.  My coworkers and I seem to frequent this location for celebrations and we've always been treated pretty well. I remember at one celebration, the waiter accidentally spilled water on me and the manager offered me a free appetizer, meal and dessert.  Just recently my coworkers and I found ourselves here again. My coworkers were very sweet to treat me to a birthday lunch here at CPK.  They know it's one of my favorite places to eat. I love all the different pizza choices on their menu. I also like how they offer all kinds of pastas and salads. This trip here I decided to choose the wild mushroom pizza with chicken. I knew i wanted this pizza when I saw that it had these different types of mushrooms (Cremini, Shiitake, Portobello and white mushrooms) . I was also intrigued with the fact that this pizza had a wild mushroom walnut pesto. I was not wrong with my choice because it was delicious :). I think I may just have found a new CPK favorite. For all the mushroom lovers out there, this pizza is for you. Along with this meal, I got the mango iced tea. It is one of my favorite drinks here.  From the very start, the folks working here were quick to greet me a happy birthday. At the end of the meal, the waiter surprised me with a birthday song and a birthday sundae. It was vanilla ice cream mixed in with chocolate syrup and whipped cream and topped with a cherry. It was great :).  Thanks again to CPK for another cool celebration here :).

Talk about a 12th round knock-out!  I've been to CPK a few times. Although its a great date spot, the food is ok- nothing amazing. Although the environment was very nice and the service was outstanding, the nucleus to any establishment is the food.  However, maybe I was just ordering the wrong dishes! Last night, I ordered the Pesto Penne with shrimp and chicken. Again, it was okay.  BUT! My buddy ordered a thin crust Sicilian pizza. This is where they got me! The meats and spices used by CPK is PHENOMENAL! It's salty savory flavor compliments the crunchy crust like milk and cookies! Right when CPK was at a 2-3 Star rating, they throw a knock-out punch with that pizza!  Well done CPK!
Terrible service and infested with Cockroaches.  Killed one on my table and saw another running across the floor!

Had not eaten there for her about a year. Stop because I felt the quality has gone down. Gave it another shot yesterday and was pleasantly surprised. Reminded me a lot of CPK a couple years ago when they were just getting started. We all had salads and took them home and were generally pleased at a four-star level.

Worst possible customer service . We waited 10 minutes after being seated and not one waiter so much as acknowledged us. Groups that arrived after we did had their order taken as we continued to be ignored . So disappointing.
I've always liked CPK, but man it's gotten expensive!

Pretty generic for a CPK. Decent service but a rarely notable, food is pretty solid for a CPK. All the various pizzas are pretty good, but it's a CPK-- they do a solid pizza but nothing exceptional and to their credit, nothing bad. The spinach artichoke dip is passable, as are the drinks. Parking is usually packed, but you can find a spot-- the Manhattan Village Mall has quite a few parking spots. 'bout the only wrinkle last time was they had the A/C blasting and despite promising to turn it down, they never did...

Service was bordering on rude. Our server didn't greet us at all and went straight to "what would you like to drink?"  We felt unwelcomed. I asked for the drinks menu and got a blank stare like I don't know what I am talking about. Made our whole experience less then pleasant.  Appitizer portions were way too small. $5 fried mac n cheese had 4 pieces, seriously? $5 chips and guacamole had 14 chips in total. Bread served with butter was cold and hard. 1 star for pizza only. Overall food tasted good but value for money is terrible. Not going to this particular location again.

Love this place. Sooo much better than the Marina Del Rey location. Here, , the friendly staff remember what you like to eat and drink and do their best to get it to you as quickly as they can. Another place I keep going back to.

Brought our salad with no silverware. Did not come by the table for so long, I had to get up and ask the front desk for silverware and to get us our salad dressing. My wife's soda cup was filthy and covered in white film looking material - I don't know how that wasn't noticed prior to bringing us our drinks. I noticed a lady who working there kept going in and out of the women's bathroom carrying cups and kitchen material. I don't know what she was doing but that was really unsettling. The food was okay,  but the service was a disaster. I wouldn't come here again if they paid me to eat.

Long story short. Waited over 20 minutes after being seated. Walked up to a manager to get drinks. Waiter was oblivious and serviced the tables AROUND me. I am aggravated with how long I have to wait. It WASN'T busy. Terrible service. Wouldn't recommend. Two girls got seated two minutes after we did, got served, finished, paid, and left.....guess what..... I'M STILL HERE WAITING FOR MY FLIPPING FOOD!!!! #outraged #wheresmyfood

Got here on a FRIDAY NIGHT and got seated right away (within 10 mins). Our waiter Jim an amazing waiter with lots of knowledge of the food here at CPK. I recommend him for anybody that comes here. The food was AMAZING. Its good to see that management was here overseeing the place and one of them (not a server) came and boxed our things. Good stuff CPK.

Great atmosphere, service is pretty good.  I met 2 Laker players before at this location for late lunch (3pm). I like their pizza, my favorite BBQ chicken,  salmon was just OK (dry) cedar plank salmon, chicken tequila fettuccine is off the hook. Try the Waldorf salad, it's a must (green apples, walnuts, gorgon zola with dijon balsamic vinaigrette).

I told my pa to get me dis "great" bbq salad that they be cookin up. I told myself, it must be good since all them white mb people be tweetin about it and what not. So when my pa come rollin up to my house down south with the salad, I say, WHOOOOOOW, hold up, dis aint right. There aint no sauce, what kinda place dont give me ma bbq sauce?! They better start doin they job right or I be running down there maself to hit them up side of the head.

Tonight we experienced cold split pea soup, cold pizza an cold salmon. While I understand any place can have an off night what was most disappointing was the lack of managements response. While in the past  if there were issues with any CPK  meal or service, as we eat here often, a manger has always been in place to correct problems and usually do something nice such as offer a discount on a next visit or dessert. Tonight the manager on duty was of no help as he was slow to correct  3 bad meals and lacked an aplogy for a very disappointing dining experience!   I also noted several of the servers seemed new and not well trained. Could this be the demise of what was once a consistently one of my favorite CPK's?

Took forever - not a good place for lunch. Server was just socializing with other tables. Took over 30 minutes to get our pizzas and they weren't even hot! Not at all hot! Overrated, better off going to a real pizza place or just getting their frozen pizzas at the grocery store.

First time ever in a California Pizza Kitchen - and as soon as he manager found out, we were given a free Nacho starter to settle us in!  The cocktails were really good and the pizzas really are very good, especially to the European palette that's looking for a good US pizza.  I know there's trendier pizzas out there, but for a good pizza and a great experience, this would be the place for me.

Oh CPK what has happened to you?  I have not been to a CPK in a few years,  I remember it having good quality food.  Not this time.  My mother got a fried chicken sandwich..the chicken looked like jerky it was awful and inedible and the roll was stale.  I can not believe they let that go out of the kitchen, shameful.  Like I said, Hadn't been there in years, won't be going back again.  Too many other good food places for those prices.

Really disappointed with this restaurant. The waiter was nice, but one of the managers was very rude. She had short blonde hair and was an older lady. When my girl friend and I walked in she smiled but when I gave my girlfriend a quick kiss the manager quickly changed her attitude and gave me a dirty look. The rest of the late lunch she sat at the bar and stared at us. She walked by us one more time and I smiled, she returned my smile with a cold mean look. We felt very uncomfortable and wanted to get out of there fast. When we got up she stared at us the whole time we left. I cant believe we had to go through this and I will never eat here again!

Never been to a California Pizza Kitchen and I grew up in CA.  Well, I finally went.  I thought I was going to a simple chain pizza joint kinda like Pizza Hut.  But this place is a little more upscale kinda like Red Lobster.  Unfortunately this doesn't necessarily mean the food is any better.   Went with two friends and we got the lettuce wrap and the white corn guacamole chip dip for appetizers.  Then we got the BBQ chicken pizza and the caramelized peach salad.  We split everything. The guacamole dish is tiny.  Maybe 2 dozen chips on the plate and a scoop of the guacamole dip.  Not great.  In fact, kinda tasteless and I really love guacamole.  A good 2.  The white corn kernels they put in there are pretty dominant in the dip but was seriously lacking in taste. The lettuce wrap actually wasn't bad.  A 3.  Pull your lettuce wrap in your hand and put their ground beef in it and bite.  Get this if you come here.  Spencer thinks lettuce wraps are just an American version of Thai Larp.  He's probably right.  This dish pretty much is that except without any of the spiciness.   The BBQ chicken pizza, meh.  Not great.  Slightly thin crust but without the crunchiness you expect from a think crust.  And the pizza's kinda small.  I could eat a whole pizza by myself.  Maybe 12" in diameter?  A 3. The salad actually wasn't bad.  I thought it had more flavor than the pizza.  A pretty decent sized salad with a good mix of greens and spinach.  If I ever come back to a CPK, I think I'll only order a salad.  What does that tell you when I go to a pizza restaurant and don't even plan to order the pizza?  Yeah, "if I ever come back".  Probably won't unless invited.

This is why I love CPK...I know -exactly- what I'm getting into. I go there on my cheat day and I'm in heaven. I want fatty, cheesy, oily food. Oh, and a glass or four of cheap white wine to wash it down with. Don't even get me started on the Spinach Dip. Don't.  I'm happy a CPK is around the corner. It's satisfying, consistent and the staff has always been sweet and friendly, even when I'm consuming a 5,999 calorie app.  It's all good. It's all heaven. (On cheat day only).

I called an order in a bit before they were officially open but they went out of their way to have the order ready.  Cindy, the manager, was very welcoming, hospitable and willing to accomadate.  Thank you!!

I wasn't in a great mood when we walked into this CPK last Tuesday night. We started out trying to eat at Sammy's down the road and couldn't get seated (please see my review for Sammy's). But we still wanted pizza so we drove just a little farther to CPK in Huntington Beach. To cut to the chase: We were greeted promptly. Our server was extremely pleasant and helpful. The food came out quickly and was good tasting. We usually go to the CPK over in Marina Del Rey and are always really satisfied. It's nice to know that perhaps the company as a whole is trying to do a good job. Ha Ha, just kidding. But we really did have a good dinner.

Great customer service!  I really appreciate how helpful the manager Chris was when I had a minor mix-up for my takeout order.  Will definitely continue to eat here.  An all around very nice dining experience

I ordered CPK through   today for my daughters birthday party at Scooters Jungle today, and what a huge disappointment. I was shocked. First, they "forgot" to prepare a catering size chicken chopped salad, so the driver had to go back. Then, when he brought it back, it was TINY!! I expected a silver tin, half tray for the close to $50+++ they charged.  Now the "guacamole" and chips. Wow. They charged $26.99+++ for a quart size plastic container full of corn and a dollop of avocado mixed in. My guests were all calling it corn dip. How embarrassing!! It was paired with the equivalent to 99 cent tortilla chips.  $49.99+++for their four cheese ravioli had no taste and again was enough to feed 4 people. Never order again. The only decent item were the sandwiches which were prepared with annoying thick bread. Everyone were scarfing them down because they were hungry and desperate. I will never order or even dine in cpk again. Catering seekers beware. My order total was around $300 for a small tray of sandwiches, the avocado/corn dip, pathetic ravioli and sorry salad. I was sitting there dreaming of all the wonderful catering I could have ordered elsewhere.

If you're a patio person, this CPK has two!  And, both are enclosed by glass walls to block the wind and PCH traffic noise.   But, unfortunately once you sit down, get situated with your iced tea and take a look around, you realize that you have a sea view! A sea of cars that is -- you're surrounded by a parking lot!  This mall area is another example of crappy, commercial development in the South Bay with no creativity or soul.   CPK was great when I was 25, but now at 38, it just tastes too over sweetened and over salted.  Is it me, or CPK?  It's artificially flavored overkill, in my opinion.  Palates only need so much flavor coating on top of food.  Step it up CPK!

This was like a 3rd or 4th choice after a weekday work lunch fell apart.  First off, like other reviews have already mentioned, parking here is a disaster!  The aisle right outside CPK is ALWAYS so SLOW ugh!  Don't even bother circling to find parking, just go 4 aisles down and walk cuz that's what you're gonna end up doing anyway.  If you work in the area, you're gonna see all your co-workers in large groups as this appears to be the default place for that kind of thing and it's very loud inside. I think I ordered the wrong thing.  I got a chicken penne w/ sun dried tomatos.  The sun dried tomatos were chewy, like TOO chewy, and I had to grind on them w/ my teeth in order to swallow them.  Fail.  My co-worker got the Sicilian pizza and I had big time order envy.  The meat toppings looked legit and not dried out. Our waitress was pretty but slow.  Granted they were slammed but we were constantly waiting on refills and she was slow to return w/ cheese and peppers, utensils for a +1, everything arrived correctly but was just VERY slow.  Not her fault per se but they were def under staffed that day. =-/

Wife ordered veggie pizza with "baby broccoli" prominently featured in the picture. When my wife got her pizza, there was no baby broccoli to be seen. Instead, they substituted it with conventional broccoli. Imagine one broccoli (golf ball sized) on each slice of pizza. When we asked the shift leader in a maroon shirt he said it's cpk policy to replace baby broccoli with conventional broccoli when they run out. I asked why it isn't policy to tell the customer first in case that makes a difference. Now, I understand mistakes can happen but what happened next is inexcusable. With an attitude and intent to make us feel guilty, he said he would comp the pizza while walking away, clearly perturbed that my wife was disappointed with the switcharoo. First of all, you don't bring up "policy." Just apologize for the damn mistake. And never, ever place guilt and shame on the customer. Finally, CPK: Pizza does not look right when you place a ping pong balled size broccoli on pizza. My suggestion? Slice them into smaller slices to make it easier to eat like a pizza. Please no more BALLS on your pizza and less attitude from maroon wearing shift leaders. Who made him a leader?
I'm writing this review to convey my thanks for the waitress Lauren and I'm giving a 5 star for her hospitality. It's a great attitude towards your customer. Wish you all the best.
Food is great. Creative and always changing. The wait isn't too long, but it is fairly busy most times.

Broccoli Tomato Fusili w/ grilled chicken & goat cheese is the way to go. Here for lunch then sit at the bar for fast, friendly service. Although, the food isn't the only reason I stop in here. The Red haired salsa dancing bar tender with the pale skin, light dusting of freckles always has a smile on her face as she handles the multitudes of hungry patrons that come her way. The rest of the staff is always friendly. I love their open kitchen design and while the menu is lacking in variety of pasta's and sandwiches there is ample variety among the pizza's for which the restaurant is named. Among the soups is a hidden delight, try the Tortilla soup its damn tasty, pair it with a sandwich, Chipotle pizza or even a mini-craver quesadila for a spicy and satisfying lunch. They offer a full bar, everything from coffees to champagne to mixed drinks and beer. Try it out, I'm sure you'll enjoy it.

Probably the best CPK out there.  Good layout, lots of booths, friendly servers, the food is about the same quality as the other cpks, they are all pretty consistent.  Worth a trip if you've never been before, or if you just like CPK and don't know what you want for dinner.  They seem to have something for everyone.  My favorite is the salad section of the menu.  Thai Crunch over lettuce instead of cabbage, add tomatoes and avocado.  WIN.

We were at the Apple Store earlier and decided to grab a bite to eat with our two kids (15 months old & 5 year old) before going home to Torrance.  Kids were hungry and getting restless so we needed to feed them ASAP.  Staff here were very friendly and were seated promptly.  Our server was nice though he did forget a few things which we kindly reminded him.  Managed to get the bread we asked a couple times for but forgot the water.  Our beverages came so we decided to stop reminding him about the water.  When our food came, my wife's pasta was on the dry side while my pizza was crispier than I expected it to be.  Normally a Hawaiian isn't that burnt.  In comparison to the CPK we frequent in Rolling Hills / Torrance, this restaurant isn't as good, IMHO.  Maybe since we're regulars at the CPK we normally go to, we get better service and food?

Been coming to CPK for years and have never been disappointed. Came here for girl's night recently. The peach salad was amazing! Actually you cant go wrong with any of their salads. I like that they will let you do half pizzas so two people who don't like the same things can share one pizza. Depending on toppings there is sometimes an extra charge for doing this but it was fair. Didn't get the hype over he butter cake...tasted like warm plain old pound cake to me.

I hate bad service.  When our food was brought to our table, 2 of the 3 dishes were hot.  My pizza was room temp.  Not good.  I was on my lunch hour, so I couldn't wait for another pizza to be made.  The waitress didn't seem to care much and offered to "warm" up the pizza.  When I told her that I didn't have time (it took her 10 minutes to bring parm cheese to our table), she just said "oh well."  Really?  H O R R I B L E

I swear, every time my office orders curbside to go something is forgotten then we have to wait ten minutes for it to be done. That's why we order to-go so we don't have to wait. Kind of defeats the purpose

Had lunch here a few times, not because i wanted to, but my co-workers made me. LOL @OLGA But yeah, its not too bad. Ive had the White pizza with Bacon, and i was amused. Maybe because ive had reaaaaaaaaaally good white pizza before, which makes all other white pizzas kinda suck for me! LOL But all in all my boss loves it, as well as my coworkers, and the last time our server was really cool.  oh.... and Parking Sucks!

I and my best friend came here last night to celebrate her 31st birthday. Since I am already of age I knew this place was awesome to grab a drink and a bite to eat. I ordered her a beer and they brought out the wrong beer! The food we ordered was good, but the service and drinks were not as good as it should be. I ordered a bloody mary and it tasted like vinegar. Her beers were not even filled to the top like beers should be at classy locations. We paid our bill and left unhappy.

2pm on a Tuesday afternoon is not crowded.  My friend and I had the truffle oil flatbread (yum!) and then salads with salmon added.  $16 for a large roasted veggie salad with salmon?  I guess.  The waiter was super nice, kept refilling our mango and raspberry iced teas.

My favorite items are the Roasted Vegatable salad and the California Club sandwich...yummy! I love that there is a selection of small craving items to choose from. New items have been added to the menu recently so it is definitely worth a trip!

Friendly staff, good food, standard cpk prices.  They will hold the door open for you if the host isn't busy.  Honestly this is one of the better CPK locations I have been too (my fiance use to work at one a few years ago). My one complaint is that they pre-make the chile relleno in the mornings so I can't order them with no mushrooms.  This is corporate wide, not this location though, so no complaints.

I already knew I liked CPK because I ate at CPK often enough as a child. But today was the day that I decided I "love" CPK. I ate the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza and it was much more tasty than I had expected, and that was a very pleasant surprise! The waiter was super nice and always made certain that my I had enough to drink or that the meal was okay. And he never came across as over bearing. I never once had to ask for a refill because he always made sure I had one. So, the place is clean, the decor is nice, the food is great and the service is equally out standing. I'll be back here and I'll recommend it to people.

As they go this CPK is  a notch above the others that I have visited. I think what makes it different is that the service is very good. The food itself is very consistent with other California Pizza Kitchens. It is a very decent pizza at a reasonable price with a menu that should keep everyone in the family happy.  I normally have lunch here and they seem to turn the tables quickly enough to seat you within a reasonable amount of time. The only drawback that I would give this location is that Parking can tend to be a pain and Manhattan Beach drivers always seem to be in a rush but that isn't the restaurant's fault.  All in all a solid three star A-OK rating and a decent place for lunch.

Honestly if you can avoid this place. I ordered just an ordinary pepperoni pizza to go. I placed my order, 15 minutes later I went in and picked up. I love the complimentary bread and rosemary garlic dipping oil however after I ate the pizza about 30 minutes of it settling I completely puked. I tried to take the excess oil off my pizza with a napkin but I guess still it was not enough that made me sick. The pizza had about 5 pepperoni's on 5 slices. Skimp rosemary. One thing they were heavy handed with was the grease. Ugh.

We visit this neighborhood CPK at least twice a month.  The food is reliably good, our kids always eat well and I think it's a good value.  We went in for dinner on 6/13.  It was busy, as it usually is, so when the host said the wait time would be 15 minutes, we knew that it would probably be less.  At the 15 minute mark, I started making eye contact with the host to make sure he knew that we were still waiting.  After 30 minutes, I approached the desk to see where we were on the list.  I found that he had accidentally gone on to the new waitlist leaving mine on the old one.  No worries- people make mistakes.  He didn't apologize, however, and when I told him that we were waiting for over 30 minutes, he still did not apologize and said that they were busy.  He brushed us off!  We asked to speak to a manager. Here's where the 5 star review comes in.  While the dining experience was closer to a 3, John turned it into a 5+ experience.  He apologized on behalf of his host right away, and had us laughing within minutes.  I kept my eye on him throughout the night, and I really enjoyed the way he interacted with his guests.  He was chatting, laughing and even giving hugs.  I walked away feeling as though I had received a lesson on how to be more forgiving and how important it is to be a great communicator.  Our CPK is so lucky to have John.  We will definitely be back...and our salad and pizza were yummy.

I swear every few months I come to CPK the menu changes. I was even more shocked that for a Saturday afternoon around 1pm the place was not jammed. I was meeting my cousin's here for lunch expecting to have a 30 minute wait but walked in to an almost empty restaurant. The looks more fancy with fancier selections from previous years. I almost always go with a pizza there but this time I opted for a 3 cheese ravioli type dish.  This is usually playing with fire when you try a dish at a place where they generally do not specialize in pasta. The dish was actually pretty good and cheesy, just how I like my ravioli.  My cousin's wife ordered a sandwich and wanted some mustard. I almost fell out of my chair when the server said they no longer carry it. WHAT? Don't people put mustard on their sandwiches? At least I do, but I could not understand the lack of reason behind the discontinuation of it.   I had a good experience but it is CPK after all, nothing that will entirely blow you away.

My flight got in late so I showed up at closing time. Called my order in expecting to be rushed out. Staff was extremely nice and helpful. Hated being "that guy" rushing in at closing, but was able to relax have a glass a wine and one or two bites of pizza before going on my way.
California Pizza Kitchen is a family favorite. We love eating here. We love the pizza, pasta, and bread. What's not to love. Great Food. Great Service. Great restaurant. Highly recommended.

I love cpk !! Its one of my favs places to.go for lunch! i always get a bbq chicken pizza and a turkery sandwhich!! sooo goood!! but the best part of this cpk is my server salavdor !!! he always refills my drinks without me having to ask him. not only that but he is so nice and fast!!!! ask for him

We came here for dinner after being ignored at china grill for over 15 minutes. Service was great by Salvador he helps us immediately brought us our drinks and recommended a appetizer. Food and service was amazing as usual and they were alway attentive.

There is something seriously wrong and weird about this CPK! Is it possibly a training site? If so, the food should be free. I have been going to CPK since the first one opened in BH. We sat down and were given menus... Our server apologized for the wait in taking our order.. I don't know where he was, but ok... He takes our order and it takes forever to arrive.. He asked if we wanted bread while waiting... But never brings it...not till after the food arrives...he does not check on us for over 1/2 an hour... No "how is everything" or coffee refills...then finally he offers a coffee refill... I really wanted to get out so I said "just the check". If I'd have known that the check was gonna take another 10 minutes, I could have had the coffee! Another issue... We could hear the wait staff arguing right next to us in the kitchen the whole time we were there... Manager appeared to be having a meeting at the bar, so not tending to his staff or customers... Also wait staff is not friendly... They all look miserable... Not very CPK ish... What is this place?

I'm giving them four stars because of the AWESOME customer service we just received. Chris and Jaime were beyond great and they really impressed us by going above and beyond. Specially Chris. We will definitely be back. And on top of it all our food was delicious

This California Pizza Kitchen is fantastic.  Ian and I have eaten here 50 times at least.  When he went to American Martyrs, I would pick him up every Tuesday and we would eat lunch here.  Generally it was not crowded--2:30 PM--and we could sit in the empty side where it was quiet and Ian Could study.  This went on for over five years.  We always got great food at a great price.  Ian went through several different food moods at California Pizza Kitchen.  Spaghetti, cheese pizza, ice cream brownie are some of Ian's favorites.   There are two very special events which took place at this California Pizza Kitchen.  First, there was a wonderful lady who worked there for several years, and her name was Joy.  She took an interest in both Ian and I.  She would always ask Ian about soccer, school, and his interests.  She hugged us every time we came after a short while.  Ian called her Auntie Joy.  Her name reflects what she brought into our lives.  If you read this someday "We love you joy!!!"  She moved on to management, and I certainly understand why. The second facilitate by Joy.  Usually I was so busy with Ian's stuff when we entered the restaurant, that I did not pay too much attention to my surroundings.  This particular day we sat facing the door.  Joy came up and was her usual self.  She leaned over and said..."Kobe Bryan is behind you. "I laughed politely, and she said "Really."  It was Kobe.  Ian asked to get his autograph as he was leaving.  Kobe reached out his hand and shook both Ian and mine.  He was really nice.  I could not believe how tall he is and how large his hands were.  He signed a California Pizza Kitchen napkin and gave it to Ian. We love this place and the memories we associate with it.
