when i review chain businesses, it's usually more about the size of the place, service, and cleanliness rather than the food, since it's generally consistent (either consistently bad, or consistently good) this cpk is consistent in their average food. i got the veggie sandwich with tortilla soup. the restaurant was pretty big; there was also a large patio. the service was a bit weak. first the waitress gave us about 30 seconds to look at the menu before she asked us if we were ready. umm no i don't read that fast. then she comes back in 15 minutes. what? yea we had to wait 15 minutes for her to take our order. we couldn't even flag her down because she basically disappeared. after we got our food, she never came around to ask how we were and it took her forever to bring us the check. blahhh bad service from the waitress! the hostess was nice though
Everything was fine, but service was mediocre at best, Gabby was unnecessarily rude. Won't be coming back!
They overcooked (burnt) our bread, and when asked for a non-undercooked bread they said "maybe, we'll see what we have."  Kind of surprised!  Not the response we expected!

CPK is pretty reliable and the food is good. It isn't anything spectacular but I can always find something I like and it is good for taking a group of people with diverse food preferences.  Staff is friendly, restaurant is clean. It has nice outdoor seating with shade.

CPK gets the the first 1 star review I've ever given. I came in around 11am and ordered a quinoa arugula salad. After half an hour there was still no salad. There is no time to eat and my food is just going to go straight into a to-go box.  What I can't understand is that when my party was seated there were two other tables. There was no crowd, no reasonable excuse for such a lengthy wait -- on a salad at that. What a waste of an hour lunch. I normally love CPK's quinoa arugula salad but today didn't go as expected. I won't be back here for lunch.

F'd at the drive through. Called order in, told it was 15 minutes to pick up.  Arrived to find out that they didn't have the order. Manager wasn't apologetic, instead made me feel stupid for not knowing to press 3 when ordering via phone since the order was (possibly) sent to their call center rather than to the Sepulveda location directly.  I guess call center "to go" orders are optional unless you know to hit "3" at some point?   The managers reply seemed to indicate that this issue is not uncommon.  So what is a customer to do?  Hit 3, I guess.   But hey, on the upside, they offered me a free cup of water. Update:  food, once prepared, was delicious.  So there's that.

I was really impressed with how fresh the ingredients were. I asked for a special mixing of two salads (spinach bad asparagus) and they did it without an issue. The service was excellent. The manager, Brian, was super hardworking and friendly! You rock Brian!!  - Ladies from DC
My experience at CPK was great!! My server JB was very friendly and helpful. JB made sure our drinks were refilled before we ever had to ask. We will come back and ask for him next time!

We got a gift card and decided to use it for a quick weekend lunch.  We know this is a pizza place, but we both opted for the pasta ;)  I got the spaghetti bolognese and my boyfriend had the shrimp fettuccine and both were really good.  I really wanted to try their strawberry shortcake (it looks so good) but was way too stuffed!  The service was really quick and friendly.
Sitting here with family experiencing the worst service in the 15 years we have been coming to this CPK. 9:28 pm perhaps to close to closing? Will not make this mistake again!!

We received unbelievable service which was astonishingly fantastic by our server Desmond. He was attending the whole left section by himself and he still manage to be on top of every table. He ran to the back for the food and always came back with a smile. We dined in other times as well and Desmond treated us with the same respect and attention.

This was my first time at any cpk and I'm not sure if it completely turned me off the entire restaurant chain or if I simply won't be returning to this location.  Unfortunately,  my boyfriend had a bug in his salad.  The hosts did replace it;  as they should have. I had the salmon,  unfortunately it was raw. The chef did come out and tried to make amends with free deserts but the damage had already been done. The strawberry short cake, was good. . . But then again that was the only edible part of my meal. I will not be returning to this location,  but I just may try a different California pizza kitchen.

Impeccable service and absolutely delicious food. Their food is always consistent at this location. my favorite is the shrimp Kung Pao spaghetti!! Delicious!! This item has been on the menu for over a decade and I'm glad its still on the menu.  The spaghetti is not soggy and the kung pao sauce totally knocked my socks off! YUM! The peanuts in the dish can be stale. Unfortunately a few times, we had it, it was stale or you can taste the oil. Next time, I'll just ask for it on the side.   They have the best BBQ chicken pizza! Yum!  always perfect and not too saucy. We always have them add extra red onions. They always ask if you want complimentary bread with dipping olive oil.

Great Service! The 3 stars on here are very misleading, unless I got lucky and got our waiter on a good day. Seekay was very attentive, and customer service was 100%. Visited this place on a Monday around lunch time. Found the place empty!
Want to have a good taste with good friends and warm welcome ? You are at the correct place.  Farmers Market Soup Five Cheese Pizza  was our lunch course  Don't forget to use your pizza dough points

Let me start off with if i was able to give it some negative stars i would. I walked in with my mother and as soon as im talking to the host to let her know how many, i get rudely interrupted by another customer who has a question for the host, which the host didn't say excuse me let me help the people who has been here 1st or vice versa please excuse me while i answer this random ladys question which still is wrong. But anyways she went along and helped the other lady who had questions and went and left her post and got another coworker to help her answer this ladys question and now both CPKs workers are helping this lady for fucking questions and me and my mother left because its ridiculous how you hire these ppl who has no idea how to help customers and there on the front line. Me and my mother was starving but had to leave and go somewhere else because we weren't going to be seated in no time! Never going there again!

CPK's Pizza is really good, and the pizza with the thin crust is so flavorful and unique to CPK.  I like CPK and Sammy's both for Pizza as far as the California modern styled pizzas.  I still love classic pizza from New York, Chicago and Italian restaurants too.  This is a nice place to go to with family. The service is good, the parking is easy, the pricing is fair.

Purely based on my takeout experience. Came in to at 4pm during a slow time with not that many patrons in the restaurant but take out seemed super busy. I gave 3 stars for falling short of meeting expectations due to the long wait in placing the order and 3 attempts to apply my pizza dough rewards. Other than that I'm a fan of the chain in general but this one location in particular seems to struggle a bit from a service standpoint.

This location gets really busy at lunch time.  It also gets a lot of big take-out orders.  People must be ordering for their office. I wanted to cash in for my free birthday dessert with purchase.  I ordered my usual favorite California Club pizza and a slice of the key lime pie.  I didn't care for the new hand-tossed crust which claims to be "lighter, crispier, and better."  I didn't think it tasted as good as before and it seemed too chewy.  I did, however, like the free dessert.  The key lime pie was great! By the way, I love their cute recyclable pizza totes that say "I'm going home with you."  Very cute!  Now you can pretend to be a pizza delivery person at home!

Great example of some quality CPK pizza.  I came here two times this week for dinner - once on a Tuesday and again on Thursday. Being in town for the week, staying close by in a hotel, and wanting a low-key place to watch 2 NBA finals games is what drove me here.  I sat at the bar both times to watch the game...Kim was the bartender once, and Jose the second time. Both of them were great - fast, accurate and attentive without making me feel guilty for spending a little longer than I usually would in the chair to watch the game.  I ordered a custom pizza the first time, and the 5cheese with tomato the second time. Both pizzas were made right, came out fairly fast, and tasted great. I ordered a wedge salad for an appetizer both times... It was better on Tuesday than on Thursday. The Tuesday salad looked and tasted fresher. On Thursday I also ordered the sweet corn guacamole. It was very tasty, but the serving size was pretty small - looked like about 3/4 of a cup. Order two of these if you want to share with someone.  All in all, I recommend this location without hesitation. I'll definitely come back whenever I am in the area.

Waitress with silver hair waited on us. as soon as we sat down she was looking right at us but waited 10 min to greet. everything was fine until we got the wrong food.. my mom ordered a BBQ chicken Sandwhich and she was given BBQ chicken pizza. I ordered a Quinoa arugula  Salad with not tomatoes, I got what seemed like extra tomatoes and picked them off because I am allergic.. We then got charged for the pizza, the Sandwhich , the salad and a glass of wine we never ordered.. Our waitress never came back to our table after she dropped Off our drinks, not even to apologize about any of her mistakes.. The only reason she got a tip was Because its the holidays..over wise it probably would have been, pay attention to your customers.. However I will Still continue to go to other CPK's because the food is pretty decent, and nice to sit down for a casual bite to eat.

Good ole CPK, definitely missed that while I was living in Sydney. Went to lunch with a friend and we decided to sit in a nice booth. Our waiter came by and was very friendly.  We ordered drinks and our food.  The bread and butter is yummy, the spinach and artichoke dip is creamy and delicious, the salads are filling and the pizza is awesome!  Some favorites include the chinese chicken salad, the waldorf salad and recently had the grilled veggie salad which had asparagus, tomatoes, avocados and a few more veggies.  Service is almost always consistently good. Never had a bad experience.

Plates were not clean, ask the waiter for other plates, again, not clean... Sore throat the next day means dirty tableware... no thank you. The pizza was served on a cold plate and was cold by the time it reached our table...
What the HELL did they do to the Jambalaya???? It don't taste the same at all!!!! Ugh!!!  I use to absolutely love this stuff.

CPK is the place I enjoy going for a salad and thin crust pizza.  My daughter and I have had bad experiences at the Manhattan Beach location more than once.  Corporate need to new management, hostess, food runners and cooks.  The waiter and or waitresses are the only staff that have been trained correctly and seem to care.  The food was returned on the last visit salad over dressed, pasta dry and pizza no toppings.  My daughter ask me do this location count the mushrooms, sausage and pepperoni that are placed on the pizza.  I wish I would have taken a picture of the pizza it slice had about 2 mushrooms, every other slice had a piece of sausage and pepperoni.  After waiting 45 minutes for an order we sent back everything but the pasta.    My daughter took it home and dock it up.  We ended up at China Grille for dinner right next door.  Great food and service.

Terrible service. Didn't have our reservation for a big birthday even after we called to confirm the day of the party. No apologies even after I showed my cell phone with exact time of call. If you want to be treated special while you are out, this is not the place. If you want to be treated like you were at the college dorm cafeteria, this is your place. Food was just so so as well. All around no reason the spend your hard earned money here.

A pizza place for a weekend lunch is not my first choice, but the two gals at work were hungry and to be honest, so I was I, so I decided to split a pizza we custom made by ordering online. It was basically a Hawaiian pizza with sausage, easy cheese. Pick-up time: 20 minutes. So by the time I get out of work, into my car and find my way over to Manhattan Beach Plaza where this CPK is located, Its time to pick-up the grub. The parking here at lunch time can be absolutely horrendous. Never fear, CPK has a couple of parking spots designated just for those customers who want to pick-up their food or for those that don't even want to leave the comfort of their vehicle, they have curbside service here, too. How lazy is that?? The pizza was waiting for me when I arrived, and fresh and delicious when we chowed down back at the office. i highly recommend their online ordering system. It worked for me.

The avocado egg rolls are an awesome appetizer. The jambalaya wasn't all that great. Won't order it again. The chicken fettuccine was ok. Needs more sauce. I'll just stick to the pizza on my next visit.

I sat at the bar and order dinner to go tonight and the bartender was spectacular. First meeting he asked me what I wanted to drink within 30 seconds gave me a glass of wine order the food double check the food made sure that everything was OK. Great customer service.
Service and environment is good but the food isn't worth it. It's a pizza specialty place but yet the peperroni w bacon pizza was anything but tasty? Not planning to return
Always a good time had a big party and was very accommodating

I was never a huge fan of this place because I can find better pizza and salad elsewhere.  What got me to come back was their chicken club sandwich.  If they don't toast the ciabatta bread, it will be nice and soft.  The chicken and bacon are flavorful and the avocado adds that perfect creaminess.  I usually get a Caesar salad as my side.  I think $13.50 is a bit pricey for a sandwich though.

I love this place! It's a great place to eat with family or friends. The customer service is always great and the service is friendly and reasonably fast. I love their Thai Chicken pizza and both the tequila chicken and jambalaya pastas. You really can't go wrong here.

Parking was horrendous in this plaza.  Wasn't sure if it was because of the holiday season or if it's generally this packed.  There was no wait for CPK, we were seated right away.  As we were being lead to our booth, this one girl (she was a patron) gave me the head to toe stare down.  WOW.  Was it because we were a minority in the area?  JFC.  No worries, I rolled my eyes right back at her!!  B*tch. Initially, our waitress "Eileen" (we looked on the receipt for her name since she didn't even introduce herself) seemed prompt and very professional.  But I noticed that we were treated slightly different than the other patrons around us.  We ordered our drinks and an appetizer.  It wasn't until almost 20 minutes later that she came to take our order.  We watched as she passed by our table TWICE to cater to the other 2 parties and did not look my way once.  How do I know?  I was was looking at her, waiting for her to make eye contact with me.  We finally got our food, but a different waitress served our food and that was when I had to ask HER for a refill on my drink.  The food wasn't even piping hot anymore, it was warm.   We watched another family get seated next to us and "Eileen" took their order immediately.  I watched and ate in silence as she came back at least TWICE to ask the other party if everything was okay.  Not once did she stop by our table to ask us.  SMH.  Seriously??  I'm glad I am not in the are often...even in the "hood", I've gotten better treatment and better customer service. CPK, I don't know what's up with the service but I was very disappointed.  After reading the other reviews, it looks like this isn't an isolated incident.  My BF and I are typically generous tippers when it comes to eating out.  We always give at least 20%, but not today for CPK.

I love CPK.. I've been going to CPK for a long time and as frequently as I can.. Not just this location but many. Despite frequenting the restaurant I've never felt the need to write a review. One of my girlfriends and I have been to this location two times this past week and had the BEST experience with both waiters. First we had Tony and then we had Steve. They are both exceptional servers and really ensure that their patrons get everything they need and are enjoying their meal. Extremely attentive and always checking back to make sure everything is ok and if anything is needed-- but they also did it in a way that wasn't too much (bc lets be honest this happens too.. Actually happened to me last month at the Marina del Rey location). But anyways -- Great service! Will definitely be coming back soon!

Like most CPK's the decor and ambiance is all the same. We stopped in to take advantage of Veteran's Day "Free Pizza" which is cool. Food was good, it's just the service. Instead of my wife's Ginger Ale she recieved a Fresca which is similar to a Squirt. Second or appetizer was sitting in front of us with no utensils for a good 10 minutes. Third after receiving our pizza's we asked for Parmesan Cheese which after 10 minutes I ended up getting myself. Rather than killing good vibes of trying to enjoy our dinner we kept it cool, but still. If it wasn't for that wasn't bad. Gotta keep it real.....two star experience.

Upon seating at our local CPK we ordered our drinks which our server was quick to respond with along with  a plate of hot sour dough bread and dip which we found to be quite tasty. Normally I order the soup and salad combination but on this particular evening we ventured outside the box and ordered a  half  salad and a Chipotle Chicken pizza that we split amongst the two of us. The half salad was more than enough for both of us as was the pizza.  The pizza was hot and crisp and just a bit spicy (which I like). Our server was friendly and knowledgeable and even recommended her personal favorite dessert, Belgian Chocolate Souffle and once again this turned out to be quite tasty.  The restaurant was well staffed and clean,. One of my pet  peeve is an unkept rest room, however this was not the case as the men's room at this restaurant was spotless and odor free.

I had the five cheese pizza.....it was dry , plain no flavor and cheese was rubbery....after telling my friend it was dry the waitress walks up and says "next time try it with the tomato sauce"  now why serve me dry pizza and tell me after to add tomato sauce? I had no words but WHY?. My friends jambalaya pasta was too salty and tasted like they had burnt the spices and didn't bother to start the sauce over.....and she was surprised I had never been there....yes and never will you see me back...thank you

I could eat this everyday. Chopped BBQ Salad with Avo, BBQ Chicken Pizza, California Veggie Pizza with honeywheat dough, and the Club Pizza are my regular favorites. Sometimes I get crazy and order the Jamaican Jerk Pizza.

This review is for the location in Manhattan Village Mall. Ample parking, though close parking can be hard to find at lunch time. Quick service, their staff seems to be well prepped for the business lunch crowd. Never had a long wait for a table. Food is typical for a CPK, which I enjoy. I especially like their thin crust pizzas, which are relatively new. They also seem to change up their menu now and then, so repeat customers don't get bored. One of the better places to dine while shopping at Manhattan Village.

Good ole CPK never disappoints. I've never come here and left in satisfied. The food is good and plentiful, and service is always great. If you want to go to a restaurant that is always consistent, affordable and satisfying, CPK is the place. This location in Manhattan Beach is one of my favs, other than the location at the South Bay Galleria.

I was so disappointed in the service. I called in at 9:15 for a Togo order and she said 10-15 minuets. And I asked if they can bring it curb side cause I'm 8months pregnant and didn't wanna have to get dressed.  And she said "no we stop doing curbside at 9:30." I was like okay well at most we are talking 5 minuets after. It was so rude and I just couldn't believe the lack of going beyond for the guest. There's a different between good costumer service and GREAT costumer service. So when I get there they over charged me for what I usually get (plain pasta with sauce) so it cost over 20 dollars for pasta and side salad, and so I kindly asked to speak to a manager. I just simply and kindly stated I felt that them not bringing it out was poor service on there part. The manger stared at me like I was stupid and was not speaking English. And then stated that its a safety issue that no employees were able to leave the restaurant after 9:30. And that if I was more clear on being pregnant he would of brought it out. Completely blaming me. And the look on his face and tone of his voice was so condescending I almost died. It was 5 minuets after 9:30 and I was like so if I came at 9:29 you would bring it out? I work in a restaurant and times are always subject to change because guest always come first. I also worked for a CPK and I don't remember it being this poorly ran. The manager never even said he was sorry. He basically blamed it on me and made me feel so stupid so I will never spend another dime at this location. I hope corporate knows who's running this place.

I will give this CPK 4 stars now. If I had reviewed it last year I probably would have given it a 2/3. I've been going to CPK for years at various locations. This one became popular because I work on Northrop Grummans site and that is a hop skip away. The last couple times I have come here the servers were neglectful of tables, not aware of surroundings and quite rude. The food, always delicious. The employees. Not so much. Something changed.  My friend and I decided on our lunch break to go to CPK. We were craving a pizza. As soon as we walked in a friendly hostess sat us down right away. After she left our server came over and he joked with us, made us laugh, gave us tips. Exactly what you would want. I even noticed the manager walking around talking to people, taking the time.  We ordered the mac and cheese deep fried which was delicious. Our server kept encouraging us to lick the plate. Then we had the original bbq chicken pizza which never disappoints.  At one point of the meal, one of the employees who seemed like an assistant manager came over to make sure the sun wasn't in my eyes and closed the blinds. It was very kind of her!  After we paid for our meal, the manager thanked us graciously and even walked us out.  That was a perfect lunch.

Outstanding service! Just flew in from out of state with suitcase and backpacks they not only accomadated me quickly the manager came over and spoke about travel while my suitcases filled the other side of the booth. They made great recommendations on what to eat as I was exhausted from 15 hours of flights and airport delays. They even let me store my luggage for 20 minutes so I could run to the store and pick up a few things before my cab arrived. Amazing customer service very friendly staff and its the california pizza kitchen you cant go wrong with the food! BBQ chicken salad add avocado...Delicious

Terrible CPK. One of my favorites is kung pao spaghetti which was completely butchered by this location into some version of garlic noodle. It was very bland and disappointing given that I have eaten and loved this dish at other CPKs. My boyfriend and I did the $30 couple deal which gave us one appetizer, two entrees, and a dessert. On the $30 deal menu it lists for entree "Kung pao spaghetti (with chicken)" I don't know about you, but that implies it comes with chicken for me! We ordered two kung paos, one with shrimp instead of chicken.   We got a shrimp kung pao and one with no meat! We asked the server, and she said it doesn't come with chicken unless we ask for it in an "it's your fault"  tone. Seriously? Anyone would assume that it came with chicken. In any case, that left an even worse taste in our mouths following the already lackluster kung pao. We will not be returning to this location.

CPK is the emergency go-to spot when you are hungry and just want something consistent.  This location is in a crowded shopping center but we were able to find space right in front.  We went during off hours on a Sunday afternoon.  We were seated immediately and the service was actually great!  I appreciate that they have expanded their menu to suit different taste's.   My daughter had a white pizza with added bacon plus their raspberry ice tea.  She said the tea was just okay and drank more water.  She did enjoy her pizza and only got through half of it. I had the grilled peach salad with added shrimp and peach iced tea.  I was happy to see this on the menu as this is something that the bf and I have made at home with grilled steak (Mens Health, low-carb/ab recipe).  We shared their spinach dip and we both agreed that it was a little too watery and the chips were slightly stale.  I suspect that they leave them in an open bin and the air softens them.   Our waiter (can't recall his name) was very friendly and checked on us quite frequently. My star deduction comes from their dish-washing.  The wine glass that was already on the table had something green stuck to it and my bread plate sitting on the table had something brown stuck to it.  Yuck!  While leaving items on the table helps with set up turnaround, it also leads to dirty dishes that are prone to catch flying food.

This is a chain of pizza restaurants that is upscale We went there on New Years Eve and Service was poor! Asked the hostess if the pizza was from a wood fired oven - she did not know Waiter walked away from our table while taking our order and returned after making the rounds of other tables No plates or cutlery was provided and we had to ask We ordered the following pizzas Mushroom Pizza  Margarita Spicy Sicilian The pizza is a thin crust style. Crisp crust with charring just the way I liked them with fresh ingredients. The sauce was very good as well. The pizzas were excellent and obviously came from a gas fired oven.

CPK is one of my top favorite places to eat. The food is always hot and the people are always great to you. The menu is amazing with a great selection and plenty of room to customize. If you want a great sit down place to eat then this is the place for you!

Despite people's hate for chains, I actually like the CPKs and TCFs.  This location is awful in the Village. Parking is crazy crazy, especially during lunch rush. However, we've ordered a bunch of times for our office lunches, and they're always consistent, ready on time, never missing any orders and always gives us bread/butter. My all time favs of CPK are BBQ chicken salad, Chinese Chicken Salad, Fettuccine w/ Shrimp and the Chicken Tequila Pasta (soooo good!!). Yum!!
First time here. The food is excellent and I will be returning! I suggest that everyone tries this place out!!

Not what it used to be.  When a large chain has been around for as long as CPK has, you get to see how it fairs over the years.  I remember when they used to be white linen tablecloths and napkins.  Now its grimy table top, sub-par service and low grade ingredients actually gross me out.  I'm sure it has to do with this particular location.  I would hope so anyway.  I went in expecting to a nice decent dinner...but really...head over to Pitfire.  You'll like it so much more.  With so many staff at this CPK, one would think they would have time to clean the place up and come through with awesome service.  Nope.  Overall generally disappointing experience.  Not coming back.

Good CPK location in Manhattan Village. Lunch time can get busy & parking can be a pain but at least it's free as opposed to let's say the Beverly Center CPK. My favs are the Moroccan salad, the spring rolls,& avocado club egg rolls. For Pizza it's a tie between The Jamaican Jerk, Veggie, BBQ Chicken & Thai.

Had the avocado egg rolls.  They were so so.  Had the Sicilian thin crust pizza, as recommended by the waiter and it was amazing.   The waiter was super cool.  Good service. The pizza was great.  Definitely would come back.
Get the wild mushroom pizza if you like mushrooms. I got it with tomato sauce instead...and it's amazing!

I've never been so upset with the customer service of a CPK . First they take too long . And when they ask is there anything else they took 10 mins before they actually came to me . I have never been so unsatisfied about a restaurant . NEVER GO TO EAT HERE

I was there two weeks ago with my nephew and they put us in an area that was unassigned to a server and I had to keep getting up to ask for things. Of course if you have a bad experience the food doesn't taste the same. We boxed our food up and got ready to leave and go figure the only time they were attentive was when someone ran the check over as we were preparing to leave. Lately it's been hit or miss with the service.

Impressed with the fact they have a gluten free menu and are highly attentive to food allergies. Service is inconsistent but the food is consistent. Gluten free crust is very good. They have crispin cider here (yellow label).

I'm a frequent customer to CPK and this one restaurant in particular, today I was in with a couple of friends to help out with some charity.  CPK was putting 20% of receipts towards Manhattan Beach's education budget this week, so, my 2 buddies and I ate fairly good! I tried a new item on their menu, Camelized Peach salad.  It had basic greens (no iceberg!), Gorgonzola cheese, cranberries, red onions, and warmed peaches, all in a light vinaigrette dressing, oh, and I order bacon for $2 extra.  It also has chicken ($4) or shrimp for extra added options.  It was missing something, it looked great yet it seemed, well, light somehow.  Oh well, if anything, it was healthier for me than if I indulged in one of their yummy pizza or pasta dishes. Will be back again, as this is in our usual lunch rotation and the help is friendly but I'll pass on this salad.
Jamaican Jerk fix! Not quite as spicy, too bad.

I'll never eat here (or at any CPK) again for 2 reasons: 1) I ate half my salad before realizing there was a LIVE MOTH in there. Covered in dressing...he started flapping around flicking it everywhere. You can imagine my horror. and 2) My favorite salad, the Waldorf, has over 1500 calories, NOT including the moth or chicken.

We're admittedly big CPK fans. We'd spent the past 6 years frequenting the Marina Del Rey one until we recently moved to El Segundo. Now we find ourselves at this location for our family dinners...probably more often than we should. Anyhoo... Seating issues. WTF do I mean by that? Well, color me loony, but, I swear to God there's always 4 or 5 tables empty and ready to go while the cramped little waiting area is aflush with gussied up Manhattan Beach MILFy Cougar-Mommas who seem more interested in comparing manicures and ankle bracelets than tending to their spoiled kids who are creating havoc, jumping off the benches, running through the aisles or all of the above. Can you guys add a waitperson to take advantage of that prime table real estate???  Granted, maybe the MDR location was just an exceptionally better run CPK, but, this scenario seems to be played out each and every time we go here.  That said, the food is consistent at CPK. We're never disappointed in that respect. We'll keep coming back.

Accent on flavor. Up beat attitude.  Nice people. A consistently good brand. That said am declaring myself old. Can't enjoy the current style males in 20's hair grooming. NASTY LOOKING HAIR. It puts me OFF to be served by people that look like they sleep out doors.

Roasted artichoke pizza is delightful.  Arugula salad starter is light and flavorful with the fresh cheese on it.   Service here is lacking on most people except the bussers. Hence the three stars.  We were there a fee weeks ago and sat for almost ten minutes until my husband went and asked for service.  He got attitude and the busser served us with the best attitude!!  Now we will only do take out because he is not a server.   CPK seems to have new bread (in the last year or so) that tastes homemade (instead of the plain white italian bread they had for years) with olive oil on the side that had oregano in it. Delicious.

In my experience the staff (hosts and servers) has always been a little slow and nonchalant at this CPK, and wait times for take out have always been longer that what I've been told when I call in, but I really liked the food so I would go back now and again.  My last order was for take out.  I arrived and called in at the time they said it would be ready, and then called 10 minutes later, and then 5 minutes later, to let them know I was there and where I was parked and still no one came.  I called again and someone finally did come out with the food and said the food was ready on time but they couldn't find me. When I said I had called to say where I was parked they gave one excuse, then when I responded to that one they blamed it on the person who had answered my calls. Unfortunately the food was not so great this time - and not just because it had cooled down.  Bad service and not great food = I won't be going back.
Love it! Always great service and delicious food - CPK Manhattan Beach, CA

Some people may argue that restaurant chains all serve the exact same food.  Although that may be true to some extent, I've found varying degrees of differences in between restaurant in the same chain.  My case in point is with California Pizza Kitchen in Manhattan Beach.  It's a great place to grab a meal for lunch!  They serve great pizzas, salads and other dishes and the waiters are really attentive.  I've been to other CPKs in the local area where they don't serve as great a portion as I usually get at the Manhattan Beach CPK.  I suppose if you patronize a place frequently enough though, they start to recognize you and go out of their way to treating you better.   When dining at CPK, I usually have The Original, Barbecue Chicken Chopped Salad.  It comes with chopped lettuce, black beans, sweet corn, jicama, cilantro, basil, crispy corn tortilla strips and Monterey Jack cheese tossed together in a garden-herb ranch dressing. They top it with chopped BBQ chicken breast, diced tomatoes and scallions.  It's a great salad.  They serve you bread and butter to complement your meal.  In fact, if you are dining with somebody, the secret is to order the full plate and split it with your dining partner.  You get the same quantity but you save money verses ordering two half plate salads separately. The ambience is bright and festive and it can get really crowded around noon during the work week so it's best to get there between 11:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. if you don't want to wait 20-30 minutes.  They also have a patio out back for dining on those warm, sunny days!

Parking could be a bitch during the evenings so be patient. There's a movieplex and mall nearby, go figure.  The service, food and ambience is excellent at this location. Loved the lettuce wraps. The big booths can hold a large family of six easily.  My Arnold Palmer was refilled constantly and I didn't have to flag anybody down.

The BBQ Chicken salad is the best thing going on at this chain.  Also, certain CPKs have a more cheesy spinach dip than others (which makes it so much better) and Manhattan Beach is one of those locations. And while we're on the spin dip, ask for it with pita instead of chips, it's even better.

Food and drinks are great! Bad thing is every time I come in and sit down, there's this gross smelly humid scent on the tables from wet towels being used over and over to clean the tables. I start out fighting the scent ...nasty!
Don't go here for lunch. They take entirely too long to deliver food and drinks. Servers were just kind chillin around even though the place was not that busy.

I am a regular customer at this location. Food is always great, but my visit this time I wasn't very happy, it took them almost 15 mins just to get a refill on and our drinks, our server was no where to be found she disappear for very long time. And getting our check after asking her took about little over 20 mins.

Eh.  The past two times we've ordered from here they got my order wrong (what's so difficult with an Italian Chopped Salad straight off of the menu??).  But they were gracious in correcting it. Salads are very good.  The pizzas are hit or miss (mainly because I don't do all of that funky stuff on my pizza).  The portions are generous.  Be very afraid if you check out the nutrition list online.  Holy scary.

Just met a girlfriend for lunch at the CPK in the Manhattan Village Center.  I must say I've always been a huge fan of the menu- tons to choose from: pizzas (obviously), great salads, and awesome appetizers.  My favs are the tuscan hummus appetizer, the new-ish Moroccan Chicken Salad (I'm a massive beet lover and they load them in this salad), and the stand by BBQ Chicken Salad (the ranch they serve with this is so good).  Oh, and if I'm not super hungary, I always get the split pea soup which has tons of barley in it.  LOVE!  The service is usually pretty consistent and the vibe of the place is very casual and easy.  Great place for lunch or a quick bite before movies across the way.

Now I'm not gonna pretend that CPK is one of those gourmet italian restaurants... cause let's all be honest, it's not. They've also hiked up their prices the past few years, but the quality is about the same. But, that aside, I do enjoy their pasta every now and then. It satisfies the craving. We came here for an impromptu dinner after shopping at the mall. I was already disgruntled by the craptastic service at the Apple store (see review below), plus I was starving. If you know females at all, you should know that's a deadly combination... I particularly find my inner bitch when I'm hungry too. So we trot across the street to CPK for some pasta. It was kinda crowded inside, but we only had to wait about 10 minutes. After the seating host proceeded to get into a mini tift with what looked like the manager, we were seated and I was excited for some food. Our waiter did not seem terribly busy to be honest, yet he was not attentive at all. He forgot my iced tea, only to remember about 50 minutes into the meal... which by the way, did not come out until almost an hour later. An hour to make fettuccine alfredo and spaghetti? I don't think so. We did not get refills on our drink, did not get asked how the food was, received no apologies for waiting so long for the food. When the check finally came and we put our payment in it, our waiter walked right by our table at least three times before finally picking it up. I watched him too, the man was chilling at a register station with another waitress just talking. I overheard the people seated behind me complaining to each other about the service too. I don't really know what's going on at this branch, but I've never received such poor service at a CPK before. Not going back to this one either.

i like the BBQ chicken pizza normally come here for lunch with co workers- friends  i have some beef with this place tho  i feel they want to be ritzy but i don't get it your a pizza place,  i normally get the wedge salad too everything taste ok . this place is by the mall so sometimes its hard to park

I stopped in to pick up two slices of red velvet cake. The girl at the take out counter took my credit card and said that it's be 10 minutes to get my slices. I figured that was just an over-estimation, but it reality it was an under-estimation!  It took much longer for them to pack up those two slices for me than I would have expected.

I prefer the CPK at a different location. This location felt a little to formal for my liking. The waiter was a little too casual, almost as if we had gone to school with him or had known him for a very long time. The food is always good.

Service is bad every time we go, unacceptable. and the restaurant is always dead! Why should it take more than 30 mins to get a couple appetizers? or just ordering food? I don't get this place. I don't like it. I usually love CPK but go to a different location if you are craving this. I don't know, I seriously give up on this place.

Christine A. says it best, "CPK in Manhattan Beach is like any other CPK."  Her spin was a little more negative, but for me, you know what you are going to get (in terms of menu and food quality).  And I have always found their prices to be a good value.  In terms of portions, CPK has never been a big portion place.  But while it appears other chains have shrunken their portions of the years, CPK has maintained the same size. This CPK is located in Manhattan Village, and it sure beats nearby L.A. Food Show, which was created by CPK's founders.  The pastas and the pizzas here are good.  Service is also fine.  To-go only parking makes it easier if you are getting something to go (especially since Manhattan Village's parking can be difficult with so many shared retail stores).

I haven't been in CPK in quite a few years.  I was shopping at the MB Mall and decided to go there for lunch. My favorite thing there used to be Chinese Chicken Salad, so that is what I ordered.  I don't know if my tastes have changed or their recipe has, but the dressing was incredibly salty!  And there didn't seem to be much chicken in it. If I go there again, I will not order the Chinese Chicken Salad. Service was good.

just your standard CPK...  I was here on a Tuesday Night I believe... So not many people were here... so had a quick service. It's probably because of lacking customers, but this places actually looked a bit larger than other CPKs.. but that could just be me. The outside of the restaurant looks a bit shabby... but inside is just like any other CPKs.. enjoy

i ordered a bottle of wine here last night - what the heck was i thinking? it's CPK - it's like ordering friggin kobe at macdonald's - dummy me. anyway... so i went to eat @ cpk with a friend and it's nothing spectacular - good but over priced pizza (dood $14.00 for a cheese pizza? albeit they have "imported" tomatoes from italy - ohhh... 'sarcasm' intended - haha) but i must admit i liked the cheese pizza - and - i really enjoyed their mushroom pesto pizza with chicken - but - it seems a lot smaller from the last time i went... in-fact i think they raised their prices too. all in all, good but pricey food (especially for pizza - c'mon people, it's friggin flour and water! do u want to know what i paid for my last water bill - $11.50! and that's for a WHOLE month! and that's considering i take 10 craps a day and flush 20 times in each sitting).  anyway, spending $60 at cpk isn't the smartest way to dine out - but ... we were craving pizza and it satisfied that need. if u want really cheap/good pizza you MUST hit up bronx pizza in SD or enzo on the west side.

This is actually my favorite place to go every weekend. I actually wish I could go here everyday. I cannot live without their Original BBQ Chicken Chop Salad. The only thing that keeps me from giving this place 5 stars is all the damn kids in there!!! Every time I go here there's always a large parties with screaming kids. Please, shut your kids up!!!!!
ehhhhhh hardly qualifies as a decent pizza.....sorry cpk but you need to get better with an authentic crust and use higher quality toppings!

We used to frequent CPK in Manhattan Beach when it was under the original ownership.  It was VERY noticeable, the new owners are cutting corners to build up the bottom line, my perception.  We had: wedge salad with Bleu Cheese Dressing (weak dressing and lettuce was "floppy"), the fish tacos with salsas (very few pieces of fish and the salsa did not taste fresh), Mac n' Cheese (OMG - you can make better from Kraft - talk about STICKY and not enough sauce), dinner salad (lettuce / tomatoes were floppy, hardly enough Ranch, weak dressing, and boxed croutons).  We never received a water refill.  They had so many staff running around training each other they forgot their customers - not good!  HQ needs to take notice - here they closed the LA Food Show to focus on CPK, BIG MISTAKE!

I frequent this CPK a lot. I like the food, sometimes the service could be better, depending if you go for lunch or dinner. The lunch servers, only a few, are a little slow, and one in particular is down right rude.  I've noticed latey, during dinner, late dinner, how much of a family restaurant this has become, which is fine, IF the parents would take control of thier kids. There's nothing more annoying than kids yelling, playing and running all around your table while you're trying to eat and the parents sit there oblivious to it all. Not the kids fault, nor the restaurant's fault, but I'd like to have dinner where I can actually hear the person sitting across from me. This being the reason for the 4 star rating.

This CPK can be 3 to 4 stars. Most of the time its a 3 star place. Food always good and the place for the most part clean. The staff is just Ok! The staff has way to many young people and managment should mix it up a little, way to much talking and not paying attention to the guests.

Parking: Mall Parking Lot Day: Wednesday Time Arrived: 12:10pm Wait Time: 10 mins Items Ordered: BBQ Chicken Pizza, Strawberry Lemonade Cooking Time: 20 mins Drink Rating (1-5): 3, probably the worst strawberry syrup lemonade ever Dish Rating (1-5): 4 Atmosphere Rating (1-5): 4, large and clean Service Rating (1-5): 4, promptly took order and quick refills Comments: It feels weird rating places I've gone to plenty of times before, especially the Americanized joints, but my goal was to review every single place I go out to eat. In a way, I'm reviewing the location as well. BBQ chicken pizza will always be my favorite here and probably the only thing I will consistently order endlessly. Another common dish for me if it was dinner time is the spinach and artichoke dip appetizer. Average Dish Price (1-5): $$ Price Total: $62 People: 4 Overall Rating (1-5): 4

While the staff are still friendly,and the location central,the menu is no longer worth the money one is paying. I gathered from a staff member the business has changed ownership,and it truly shows. We will never go back. Pizza size has shrunk,so it no longer feeds 3 , and the once large ( even in the small size) chopped salad is about 4-5 spoon sized servings , and includes commercial grade turkey sliced in with fewer garbanzo beans, presumably to compensate for the almost invisible salami, and a few pieces of chopped tomato. I'm very disappointed that the idea of reducing portion sizes ,and increasing prices is the way the new owner welcomes return clients. As I said,we shall NOT be returning.

Bad service even though the restaurant was dead, our waitress NEVER once offer to refill our drinks. After our food was served, we're literally on our own. There were plates on other tables that were sitting there since we came in that was never picked up or cleaned. Kinda gross. We're long-time CPK customers but will never visit this location. It's the worst we've ever been.  What's the point of ordering food at a restaurant if there is NO service?

I happen to be a CPK junkie and when I went to their  Manhattan Beach location last week, I noticed that their service seemed to be exceptional...and the people working there were extra friendly. The food always hits the spot because I know what to expect.....there is something to say about consistancy.

they're stingy with the bread. they won't give it to you unless you ask. their tostada pizza is a bit dry. their thai pizza lacks a certain peanut sauce flavor necessary in a thai dish. but you can never go wrong with the pear and gorgonzola pizza.

I obviously ordered the wrong pizza looking at the rave reviews this place has received.  I HATED the garlic chicken pizza they delivered to my table.  It tasted nothing like I thought it would at all.
The CPK chain is lost on me.  Dont really get the whole concept of their pizzas.  BBQ Chicken should not be done on a pizza ...
couldn't wait to try this after reading the reviews. I was not disappointed. garlic shrimp fettucini was awesone, also the italian peach soda is sooo good. Pizza was ok.

I'm not normally a fan of chain restaurants but CPK is a safe choice if you're not looking to be adventurous and just want something quick and good.  I've been to many locations and they're all pretty standardized.  Pizzas are always a good choice no matter which one you end up picking.  I like their tropical drinks too.

I love sausage but the Milan Neopolitan pizza was salty or too heavy.  It needed Caesar salad.  Mango tandoori chicken pizza is really good.  Usually we get Thai chicken pizza to go to eat in traffic.  We also had hummus and lettuce wraps.

For one of the few rare times, my dish (chicken tequila fettuccine) was actually really good.  We came here during lunch and it wasn't that busy since we beat the lunch rush so our server was attentive.  Right when the lunch rush hit, we didn't see her often.  Practically not at all.  I know that it's hard when a rush comes in but this is a chain restaurant so each server has only 5 tables.  I expected a little more from her.  Anyways, she boxed my food and completely forgot to bring it out...I had to ask for it.   As always, CPK is pricey for the quality of it's food.  For 4 people, how did a lunch tab come out to be $77 including tip?!  That's ridiculous.

CPK is pretty consistent in their food quality and is somewhat reasonable for the quality and quantity of food, (ex-drinks). I usually have a glass of chardoney when I'm there for dinner but the number of ounces seemed to be less (or smaller glass?) last time I was here, so I had water with my Thai chicken pizza and my daughter had a 1/2 salad with chicken. I noticed that the soft drinks are $2.75 and flavored tea or lemonade is $3.25 -so that option can add nearly $9 to the bill for two fruity iced teas with tax & tip. Their service was good and they have a new promotion called "Pizza dough" where once you spend $100 you can get $5 off reward. My server gave me the card to register. I was happy with the Thai pizza but the amount of cheese on the pizza seems minimal and the crust is really thin. I wish they had a thick crust option at CPK even if it took longer to bake. Server kept water glass filled and brought a complimentary scoop ice cream for birthday (next week).

I like CPK, but I'm not big on spending my lunch time here during the week. Number one reason....you end up spending more time waiting for service than actually enjoying your pizza - I know its coz they're in the heart of the Manhattan Village plaza, but still no excuses (-2*s)! Although, I would agree with Marisa F., the CPK chefs no matter where I've been, including this place in the Manhattan Village plaza always serve up a pizza with the same quality. My CPK recommendations are the Jamaican Jerk Chicken or Thai Chicken pizzas if you like a lil spice in that slice...

Ok standard CPK, I went today.  My waitress was extra attentive, it was kind of annoying but id rather that than an absent one.  Finally tried the Kung Pao Spaghetti ...super yummy...as it was the middle of the day on a tuesday wasnt crowded at all. no complaint.

Sorry, but 40 minutes is too long to wait for a kids cheese  pizza and a salad to show up. The pizza was cold and the salad was left out and the manager had to re-toss it. Yum!!  Warm soggy salad! This isnt the first time I have eaten here and had this happen. This manager said the same thing the last manager told me- "I have only been here 4 months and we are working on it" This location seems to go through store managers like underwear. If you want hot food from here you better order "take out". On a good note: The management handled my complaint in a text book fashion and was very polite and apologetic...

CPK in Manhattan Beach is like any other CPK. I was in the area and only came here because it was close and convenient. the service was pretty slow- but it was pretty late in the evening.  ehh- it just like any other CPK. nothing special.

do not waste your money on a cheese pizza here. if you're forced to come here, get a fun pizza with cool toppings. my pizza was greasy with burned, thin crispy crust, and i didn't even order the thin crust. parking was horrible, probably because i ordered it "to go" at lunch time. i'm never coming here again, too many really great other places in the area. two stars for good service, though.

My coworker got me a gift card for my bday almost a year ago because it was her favorite restaurant =| haha. Anyway, I was never a big fan of CPK.  I dig out the gift card the other day and went with a friend.  We've ordered thai crunch salad, The Hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza and a jambalaya with drinks.  Food was ok, waiters are nice, but the service is way too slow.  I mean CPK wasn't fine dinning, you don't really have to go course by course. We probably waited 15 mins after we finished the salad before we get the pizza and a jambalaya.
Do not order the guacamole.  It's basically corn held together with a little avocado.  They should call it corn dip. Very disappointing for someone who loves all things avocado.

Everything is great, except for one thing, and you can call me crazy if you like, but I absolutely HATE the Flex-Tip Straws! I feel like I'm in a hospital drinking out of a straw like that or at Chuck E. Cheese....C'Mon, get with it!
Make reservations or else sit at bar (kids allowed). Located in the middle of the mall parking lot.

This review is for the curbside delivery service only.  The quality of the food is what you would expect from a chain restaurant.  Curbside parking spots were all taken upon arrival. so I had to park in an illegal spot to wait for curbside delivery.  Called the number and the person on the phone confirmed that they will be out shortly.  I waited 10 mins and no one came out.  I went inside to inquire and no one was waiting at the take out counter so why would curbside delivery parking be full? I asked the server why it was taking so long and she said that she was not informed.  The manager (which I'm assuming since she was not wearing a uniform) reiterated that she was not told.  But then what's the point of me calling to ask for curbside delivery upon arrival? Manager then condescendingly explains that the phone is picked up by everyone in the restaurant and not just the take out counter, and the person who picked up originally did not inform the take out counter.  Then why would the phone system have a number to press to indicate that you are there for curbside delivery? That seems very inefficient.  Either way, someone in the restaurant screwed up and a sincere apology from either the server or manager would have sufficed, rather than not taking any accountability for wasting my time.  Besides waiting 10 minutes, no parking and the hassle of going inside when I indicated curbside delivery, I get attitude from the staff and manager, rather than a sincere apology.  This is extremely unprofessional.  There are lots of other restaurants in the area who are much more deserving of paying customers.
Had a great dinner here the other day. David was our server. The food was timely and great. Was surprised with how good the margaritas were too! Great place!

Plan on waiting if you go during the lunch hour; seriously. I'm accustomed to the mad rush hour between 1130 and on in restaurants anywhere, however when we arrived at CPK, we were promptly seated but our food took a good 15 minutes to arrive. We were given refills after our first glass was gone, but then our server disappeared! The manager came over to clear our table and hand us our check. Suddenly our server reappeared after a 20 minute hiatus. Bleh, slow service but decent food. I dig the fish tacos. Also tried half a slice of the spinach and artichoke 'za and it was killer.

i've eaten in too many cpk airport locations to really be excited about coming here voluntarily for lunch but after getting tied up in traffic, i didn't have a lot of time so i came in and sat at the counter. nice airy location with patio seating available. i was not there during peak hours so service was quick, the pizza tasty and, like a bad date, i was in and out quickly. if it were my joint, i'd let all the young staffers know that making the host stand a hangout takes away from any upscale feel the place might otherwise have.

I'm giving this chain 4 starts because of consistency. not because of 'flair' or fine dining points. just because when you're a regular at CPK and you know what you want and you get exactly what you want than that = happiness. I love CPK because it gives me inspiration about pizza I can make at home. my latest home creation is the BLT pizza. so easy and so delicious. here's my version of a CPK pizza: 1 TJ's fresh pizza dough ball  1 head of romaine lettuce 1 avocado - diced very small 1 lg or 2 small tomatoes -diced very small 6-8 slices of bacon, cooked and chopped  (I use turkey bacon) 1/4 cup of ranch dressing ( I use 'just 2 good' dressing) 1 cup shredded mozz cheese stretch the dough, cook on a pizza stone in a hot oven until cooked through mix all the salad stuff in a bowl.   top the crust with the salad mixture, cut and enjoy! I love the carne pizza, the mexican pizza..the chopped salads...mmm...

Being from NY there's just certain things that don't belong on a pizza, namely, chicken, lettuce, walnuts, carrots, thai food... pretty much most of the weird combinations that CPK concocts. If any pizzeria served up a pie with Asian food thrown on top I think the chef would get his kneecaps broken. Don't get me wrong I love Asian food, just not on my pizza. Yah dig? Aside from this bizarre stuff, CPK's normal pies ain't half bad. I would certainly eat it any day of the week over Pizza Hut. I do find the Sweet Sausage and Onions pizza pretty acceptable, as is the Pepperoni, Mushrooms and Sausage. The Neapolitan also goes down pretty steadily too. They have a nice variety of salads too that go befittingly with the pizza. Have not tried any of the pasta dishes though.
LOVE the bbq chicken chopped salad!  Had a great dinner there last week with a large group of friends from work and had excellent service!

We were seated quickly yet we waited about 10 minutes for a server. The server was very apologetic and offered a free dessert or appetizer. We chose an appetizer.  The manager came and apologized to us as well. The server was consistent with our refills as well as our satisfaction.  The food was tasty and the service was great.

My coworkers turned me on to this place. I've had the BBQ Chicken Pizza & the Meat Lovers Pizza. Both are pretty good but that meat lovers is straight up heart attack bait.......................joking of course. The prices are fair too. You can get your drink on there too.

I eat the Waldorf Salad with Balsamic Vinagrette at LEAST 4 times a week when at work. This is my FAVORITE meal. Ever. I think the employees here know me by name. If you havent tried this salad you must!

I don't understand why CPK is 4 stars at the time of this writing. The food is okay. Nothing spectacular nor worth writing home about. I usually get the tried and true BBQ chicken pizza. Or the Korean BBQ Beef Pizza (not bad! Interesting on a pizza for sure).  But for the price? Not a chance. There are so many places I'd rather go to if I had to pay $15 (tax + tip included in that number) for lunch. On the bright side, it's clean, the staff is friendly, the food comes in a reasonable amount of time, and it's never too crowded.
Waldorf salad without celery and with fat free balsamic vinagerette is good with bleu cheese candied walnuts grapes,

I use to frequent this place a lot when I was a young child.  I first had CPK at Stephen Wynn's newest Las Vegas Hotel at the time, The Mirage.  My parents and I were hooked!   At the time, there weren't too many CPK's in California.  This location was the closet one to us.  Only 10 miles away, yet 30 minutes to commute because of crazy PCH! Back in the day, I was able to eat a full Chinese Chicken Salad, several pieces of bread, a few glasses of Lemonade and and and a shrimp marsala in marinara sauce.  Let's say this kept me full for the next couple hours until I needed to eat my next meal! Service is fast here!  The waiters are not overwhelmed with several tables on their shift.  Food arrival is perfectly timed and you're not rushed to leave upon finishing your main meal. I don't eat here as much anymore since there's a CPK near one of my favorite movie theatres!

We eat here every so often, because it's a somewhat trendy place to eat, the staff is pretty friendly and we like the food.  The prices are a bit on the high side for what you get, however.  The wait can also get pretty long--easily 20 minutes for lunch or dinner.  My favorite is the Sicilian pizza.
